0.title: Shruti shares childhood pic, says 'The child in us always has more wisdom'
0.article_body: Shruti Haasan took to her Instagram handle and shared a childhood picture of her in school uniform. Sharing the post, she wrote, "Our most defining moments the ones that shape us forever happen in childhood...Sometimes those memories we can't let go off...The child in us always has more heart and wisdom than we pretend to have as grown-ups."

1.title: Sridevi had passed away, I did it out of love for her: Vidya on 'Nerkonda...'
1.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that she took up the Tamil film 'Nerkonda Paarvai' for the love she has for late actress Sridevi and filmmaker Boney Kapoor. "I didn't even give it any thought...Sridevi had just passed away...I met Boney ji...who said, 'I want you to do a special appearance in my film'...I said, 'I don't want to...know anything'," Vidya added.

2.title: 51,061 positions for health workers lying vacant across country: Centre
2.article_body: As many as 51,061 posts are currently vacant for workers in various primary health care sectors across India, Union Minister of State for Health, Bharati Pawar, told the Rajya Sabha. Pawar said there were 38,465 primary health centres, community health centres, sub-district/divisional hospitals and district hospitals, including central government hospitals across the country as of March 31, 2020.

3.title: Tired of working; helping poor, needy without any recognition: Faisal
3.article_body: Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son, Faisal Patel took to Twitter to say that he is "Tired of working and helping the poor and needy without any recognition". "Keeping my options open could mean I am thinking of quitting public life forever," he wrote on Twitter, while also tagging the official Twitter handle of the Indian National Congress.

4.title: Thief gets stuck in Andhra temple's window while escaping with ornaments, video viral
4.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a thief being stuck in the window of a temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district. The thief got stuck while trying to escape with silver ornaments he had stolen from the temple. The police opened the temple and moved him out of the window before taking him into their custody.

5.title: Take money back if it doesn't make you cry: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
5.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', Ranveer Singh said people who don't cry after watching the movie are welcome to take their money back. The film's producer Maneesh Sharma earlier stated that Ranveer has delivered a performance of a lifetime. "His performance makes me marvel yet again at what artistic heights this fine actor is capable of," added Maneesh.

6.title: Delhi HC directs MCDs to file report on spa centres running with valid license
6.article_body: The Delhi HC on Tuesday directed the three municipal corporations of Delhi to file a report regarding the number of spa centres in their jurisdictions. The court also asked how many of them are running legally with a valid license or otherwise. The bench has listed the matter on August 30, 2022, for further hearing.

7.title: Paytm CEO's stock options to vest only when its market cap crosses IPO level
7.article_body: In a letter to shareholders, Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said, "My stock grants will be vested to me only when our market cap has crossed...IPO level on a sustained basis." The stock is down "significantly" due to "volatile market conditions", he added. Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares had fallen over 70% below its IPO price since its November listing.

8.title: BEST to introduce multi-purpose mobile vans in Mumbai to pay utility bills
8.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking will introduce multi-purpose mobile vans which would move around Mumbai to enable people to pay all their utility bills starting from April 7. "We are starting with one van this week and in total there will be five vans that shall be put in service," BEST Undertaking's General Manager Lokesh Chandra said.

9.title: India stands firm on its interests when the world is divided into 2 factions: PM Modi
9.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the 42nd foundation day of BJP on Wednesday said, "Today, there is an India in front of the world which stands firm for its interests, without any fear or pressure." He added, "When the entire world is divided into two rival factions, India is being viewed as a nation that can firmly speak about humanity."

10.title: Experiencing fame at an early age can lead to trauma: Cole Sprouse
10.article_body: Actor Cole Sprouse, who rose to popularity with his twin brother Dylan on the Disney programme, 'The Suite Life of Zack and Cody', said experiencing fame at an early age can lead to trauma. Comparing his experience to that of young ladies on the channel, Sprouse said the young women on the channel were "heavily sexualized" from a young age.

11.title: Samson must be questioned for giving easy pickings to Karthik: Gavaskar
11.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said RR captain Sanju Samson must be questioned for giving easy pickings to Dinesh Karthik, by keeping no fielders in the deep on the on-side in the 19th over of RCB's innings. Prasidh Krishna conceded 12 runs in the over with 15 runs to defend, as Karthik scored consecutive boundaries. RCB beat RR by four wickets.

12.title: Gupshup acquires AI platform Active.Ai in its 2nd acquisition this yr
12.article_body: Conversational messaging unicorn Gupshup has acquired Active.Ai, a conversational AI platform used by banks and fintech firms. Gupshup had acquired Knowlarity Communications, a cloud communications startup, earlier this year. Active.Ai offers a Conversational Banking as a Service (CBaaS) platform across 43 countries. Its customers include Axis Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Tata Capital.

13.title: Karthik was frantic at KKR, there was a lot on his mind: Brathwaite
13.article_body: Ex-KKR all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite said former KKR captain Dinesh Karthik seemed frantic while representing the franchise and it almost seemed like he was hunting for a score. "There was a lot on his mind," added Brathwaite. Karthik scored an unbeaten 44 off 23 balls at a strike rate of 191.30 in RCB's IPL 2022 win against RR.

14.title: Was waiting to tell the world about it: Rashmika on working with Ranbir in Animal
14.article_body: Speaking about sharing screen space with actor Ranbir Kapoor in her upcoming film 'Animal', actress Rashmika Mandanna said, "I'm...thrilled, that the announcement is finally out." "I had been waiting to tell the world about it, because not only is the story...amazing but also the team I get to work with, it's like a dream come true," she added.

15.title: Entering girl's house this way unsafe: Karan on photographers chasing Tejasswi
15.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra, while speaking about photographers chasing actress and his girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash, said that entering someone's house, especially girl's, is not safe. "Uncle and aunty [Tejasswi's parents] got flustered...because they didn't know what was going on...I felt like this is something I need to address...I spoke to them (photographers)...they understood my concern," Karan said.

16.title: CBI arrests ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in corruption case
16.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in the corruption case registered against him. This comes after CBI took custody of Deshmukh's personal secretary Sanjeev Palande, personal assistant Kundan Shinde and dismissed assistant police inspector Sachin Vaze. A PMLA court on Friday allowed CBI to take custody of Deshmukh, Palande and Shinde.

17.title: 18.5% swabs from maternity, labour rooms show bacterial contamination: Study
17.article_body: A Gujarat-based study found maternity units and labour rooms of public health care facilities may not be free of bacterial contamination. After 195 swab samples were reportedly taken from various surfaces such as beds, mops, sink-taps, it was found that 18.5 per cent show bacterial contamination with highest contamination seen in labour rooms, followed by maternity units and general wards.

18.title: Fire breaks out at a house in Delhi's Badli extension, 8 rescued
18.article_body: Eight people were rescued after a fire broke out at a house in Badli Extension near Delhi's Rohini around 6 am on Wednesday. "Upon receiving the information, a total of three fire tenders were rushed to the location," said Atul Garg, Director, Delhi Fire Service. While the reason behind the fire is yet to be ascertained, cooling operations are underway.

19.title: 4 of family, including 5-yr-old child, killed in road accident in Odisha
19.article_body: A man, his two daughters and his five-year-old grandson were killed after their motorcycle was hit by a speeding van in Odisha's Ganjam district on Tuesday. According to police, the accident occurred in Indhanapur when they were returning from Munigadi. Following the accident, villagers reportedly blocked a section of the Aska-Bhanjanagar road demanding compensation for the deceased's family.

20.title: Ex-Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel stopped from leaving India
20.article_body: Former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel on Wednesday said he was stopped from leaving India at the Bengaluru airport. Tagging PMO, Patel asked why he was put on the "exit control list". He later tweeted, "CBI officer called to say I am on the look-out circular because of the case [PM] Modi government has filed against Amnesty International India."

21.title: Trailer looks meaner, leaner & stronger: SRK on actor Vijay's film 'Beast'
21.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan on Tuesday took to his official Twitter handle to share a good luck message to Thalapathy Vijay for his upcoming film 'Beast'. Sharing the post, he wrote, "Sitting with @Atlee_dir who is as big a fan of @actorvijay as I am. Wishing the best for 'Beast' to the whole team...trailer looks meaner...leaner...stronger."

22.title: PM Modi-led govt gave new definition of governance in last 8 yrs: Hardeep Puri
22.article_body: PM Narendra Modi-led government has given a new definition of governance in the last eight years, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on the occasion of BJP’s 42nd foundation day on Wednesday. "I would like to give you an example of UP. We received success there because development was done there rapidly and with all sincerity," he stated.

23.title: Woman damages 2 luxury cars of ex-boss after being sacked in Chennai, held
23.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly damaging two luxury cars of her former employer, a Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) worker, in Tamil Nadu's Chennai after she was sacked, police said. She hurled stones at cars following which their windshields got damaged, police added. The woman used to work in a chain of salons owned by the employer, police stated.

24.title: Dad sold his house after film with Dharmendra got delayed; was huge loss: Rupali
24.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly revealed her father, filmmaker Anil Ganguly, had to sell his house after a film that he was doing with actor Dharmendra got delayed. "People used to sell their houses to make movies...like how it happened with us," she said. "This Dharmendra film...got delayed for four years, [it] resulted in a massive loss for the family," she added.

25.title: Shreyas needs to be mindful of the game, take some time on field: Shastri
25.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer needs to spend some time on the field before playing his shots. "As a captain, he should be a bit mindful...of the game...The way he got out in the last two matches, he could've easily taken four-five balls and tried that shot. There was no...hurry," explained Shastri.

26.title: Constitution allows me to eat meat when I like: TMC's Mahua Moitra
26.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra said she lives in South Delhi and the Constitution allows her to eat meat when she likes and the shopkeeper the freedom to run his trade. Her statement came after the South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor, Mukkesh Suryaan, issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri.

27.title: Number of commuters increases in Mumbai's AC local as mercury soars
27.article_body: With the rise in temperature in Mumbai, the number of daily passengers using AC locals has jumped, the officials said. In first four days of April, we have already seen around 1.07 lakh commuters using AC locals, the officials added. In March, there were 4.76 lakh passengers, whereas in February, 3.14 lakh passengers travelled using AC locals, they further informed.

28.title: When your ex comes back to haunt you: RR on Chahal bowling against RCB
28.article_body: Referring to Yuzvendra Chahal bowling against his former team RCB in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday, RR tweeted, "When your ex comes back to haunt you." Chahal went on to register bowling figures of 4-0-15-2 in the match. He took wickets of David Willey and Faf Du Plessi, and was also involved in Virat Kohli's run-out.

29.title: Paytm says it will break even operationally in 1.5 years, shares jump
29.article_body: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications jumped over 6% during intraday trade on Wednesday after the company said it expects to break even on an operational basis over the next year-and-a-half. "We are going to achieve this without compromising any of our growth plans," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said. The company's shares have fallen around 70% below its IPO price.

30.title: Class 10 student cheats through WhatsApp by hiding phone in glass clipboard in Haryana
30.article_body: A Class 10 student was caught by the flying squad of Board of School Education Haryana (BSEH) for cheating during his English board exam in Fatehabad district. The student was using a glass clipboard with a mobile phone stuck to its middle. He had opened several apps, including WhatsApp, to cheat. He was hiding the phone with a paper.

31.title: At 24, I went to US with my broken English, home food to chase my dream: Agarwal
31.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal said he left for the US when he was 24 to expand his cable business and buy second-hand equipment. "With my tooti-footi (broken) English, a suitcase filled with ghar ka khana and a...friend from Bihar...I took off to chase my dream," he recalled. He stitched $500 to his coat's inside due to fear of pickpockets.

32.title: Kabaddi player shot dead at Punjabi University in Patiala
32.article_body: A kabaddi player, Dharminder Singh, was shot dead after a clash in front of Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night. Singh was reportedly mediating between rival groups when he was killed. The incident comes after international kabaddi player Sandeep Singh Nangal Ambian was shot dead by four assailants in Jalandhar on March 14.

33.title: Dhanashree Verma's reaction to Yuzvendra Chahal taking wicket against RCB goes viral
33.article_body: YouTuber-choreographer Dhanashree Verma's reaction to her husband, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, taking the wicket of RCB's David Willey has gone viral on social media. Dhanashree was seen aggressively pumping her fists in the air. Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-15-2 against RCB. Notably, Chahal had represented RCB from 2014 to 2021.

34.title: Ruchi Soya shares fall 19% after ₹4,300-cr FPO allotment announcement
34.article_body: Ruchi Soya shares fell over 19% during the early trading hours on Wednesday as its board cleared the allotment of 6.61 crore equity shares via a follow-on public offer (FPO) to raise ₹4,300 crore. The company fixed the issue price at ₹650 per share. The firm had received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an FPO in August last year.

35.title: Karthik needs to put his name back in international cricket: Plessis
35.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis has said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik is playing his best cricket and needs to put his name back in international cricket. Karthik has remained unbeaten in IPL 2022 and has scored a total of 90 runs, including 11 fours and 5 sixes. "His calmness towards the end allows others to just come in," stated Plessis.

36.title: PM Modi criticises dynasty politics on BJP’s 42nd foundation day
36.article_body: Addressing party workers on BJP's 42nd foundation day, PM Narendra Modi criticised dynasty politics saying it harmed the country a lot in past decades. "Two kinds of politics are going on - one of love for family, other of love for nation," said Modi. "These [dynastic] parties didn't let the youth progress and always betrayed them," he added.

37.title: BJP's Kirit Somaiya siphoned off ₹58 cr raised to save INS Vikrant: Raut
37.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut accused BJP leader Kirit Somaiya of allegedly siphoning off ₹58 crore that was crowd-funded to save INS Vikrant. "Somaiya had offered to help out with the fund-raisers and said the amount collected would be handed over to Maharashtra Governor. The Raj Bhavan (in an RTI reply) has stated that no such money was received," Raut said.

38.title: 100% adult population in Mumbai fully vaccinated against COVID-19: BMC
38.article_body: All eligible beneficiaries above 18 years of age in Mumbai have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) informed on Tuesday. The entire adult population comprising 92.39 lakh people have been given both doses of the vaccine, BMC said. With this, Mumbai has become the first major city in India to fully vaccinate 100% of its adults.

39.title: BJP giving competition to vote bank politics: PM on party's foundation day
39.article_body: BJP is giving competition to vote bank politics, PM Narendra Modi said on the occasion of the party's 42nd foundation day. "BJP has not only given competition to this vote bank politics but has also been successful in explaining its disadvantages to the countrymen," he added. "The youth...have now started to understand...'parivarwaadis' are the biggest enemy of democracy," PM stated.

40.title: Soni reunites with Helen after 20 years, says 'Making some wonderful memories'
40.article_body: Actor Soni Razdan has shared pictures as she reunited with veteran actor Helen for an upcoming project. Taking to Instagram, Soni shared pictures of her meeting Helen at a restaurant. She captioned the post, "We actually met up again after more than 20 years. We share some wonderful special memories! And we're on the verge of making some more."

41.title: Hardik is not chubby and bubbly any more: Ex-chief selector MSK Prasad
41.article_body: Ex-chief selector MSK Prasad said Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is not chubby and bubbly any more, adding that getting married as well as being GT's captain will help him. "Whenever Hardik does well, I feel proud and I feel like my own son has performed. The beauty about this boy is that his basics are very strong," stated Prasad.

42.title: BJP fulfilling aspirations of poor: Amit Shah on party's 42nd Foundation Day
42.article_body: BJP leader Amit Shah on Wednesday extended greetings to party workers on BJP's 42nd Foundation Day. "Under leadership of Narendra Modiji...BJP has become a means of fulfilling the aspirations of crores of poor, farmers, downtrodden and women of the country deprived for seven decades," he tweeted. He further said that BJP's journey has been about national service, upliftment and reconstruction.

43.title: Suppose it's ok to ban non-Muslims from eating in public during Ramzan: Omar
43.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has expressed his views amid the ongoing meat-ban debate. "During Ramzan we don't eat between sunrise & sunset...I suppose it's OK if we ban every non-Muslim resident or tourist from eating in public, especially in the Muslim dominated areas. If majoritarianism is right for South Delhi, it has to be right for J&K," he wrote.

44.title: 3 cash-loading employees steal ₹77 lakh, set ATM on fire in Mumbai; held
44.article_body: Three employees of a cash-loading and management company have been arrested for allegedly misappropriating ₹77 lakh from an ATM in Mumbai's Goregaon and setting it on fire. "We suspect the trio may have conspired with a few co-workers...and are interrogating them further for leads," a police official said. "The misappropriated sum is yet to be recovered," the official added.

45.title: Ishaan to train for Dhyan Chand's biopic, undergo intense preparation: Report
45.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter will reportedly start shooting for late hockey player Major Dhyan Chand's biopic in November or December. "Ishaan will also start training for the part a couple of months before they start shooting for the film. It will be an intense prep. Meanwhile, work on the final script is on," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying.

46.title: Will take at least 10 yrs to clear Ghazipur landfill: Delhi civic body
46.article_body: East Delhi Municipal Corporation (EDMC) has told Delhi Assembly's Environment Committee that it will take at least 10 years at peak performance to clear the Ghazipur landfill, panel's chairperson Atishi said. "EDMC commissioner pointed out that the amount of garbage being treated every day at the landfill is almost equal to the fresh garbage being added there," she added.

47.title: Will Smith-led VC firm invests in blockchain network Boba
47.article_body: Ethereum blockchain scaling platform Boba Network has raised $45 million in its series A round, from Will Smith-led Dreamers VC, Paris Hilton and her husband Carter Reum's M13 and cryptocurrency exchange Crypto.com, among others. The funding has pushed Boba's valuation to $1.5 billion. Boba Network's crypto token's market capitalisation rose over 19% to $272.1 million after the announcement.

48.title: Man held for posing as Army officer, cheating job aspirants in Maharashtra
48.article_body: The crime branch unit of Satara Police in Maharashtra arrested a man who posed as an Army officer and cheated many job aspirants for lakhs of rupees on the pretext of helping them in recruitment, said officials. He had been taking ₹9 lakh from each aspirant candidate, ₹4.5 lakh before and ₹4.5 lakh after the recruitment, police said.

49.title: Not in India's best interest to continue investing in Russian equipment: US
49.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Tuesday that it expects India to scale down its dependence on Russian military equipment. "We continue to work with them (India) to ensure that they understand that it's not in their...best interest to continue to invest in Russian equipment," Austin told the members of the House Armed Services Committee during a Congressional hearing.

50.title: We are desi: Abhishek recalls his reply to Oprah about him living with parents
50.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who appeared alongside his wife actress Aishwarya Rai in an episode of The Oprah Winfrey Show in 2009, recalled the response he gave to the host Oprah Winfrey when she was amazed by the concept of children continuing to live with their parents even as adults. He said, "It was a big deal for her...We are desi."

51.title: Reduce import duty on newsprint: Sushil Modi tells Centre
51.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi urged the Centre to reduce import duty on newsprint to help revive the newspaper industry, which is impacted due to supply shortages of newsprint amid Russia-Ukraine crisis. "India is extremely reliant on newsprint import and is the largest importer of newsprint globally, importing 45% from Russia alone," he said. "Newspapers...are essential for democracy," he added.

52.title: Ivanka Trump testifies before House panel on Jan 6 Capitol attack
52.article_body: Ivanka Trump, daughter of former US President Donald Trump, testified for about eight hours via video-conferencing before the House panel probing the Capitol attack on January 6 last year. "She's answering questions… not in a broad, chatty term, but she's answering," said Representative Bennie Thompson. "She came in on her own… We did not have to subpoena," he added.

53.title: Dentist in Chhattisgarh cheated of ₹81 lakh in Chinese 'pig butchering' crypto scam
53.article_body: A dentist has been cheated of ₹81 lakh in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district in a Chinese 'pig butchering' crypto scam. A woman named Anna Li, suspected to be from Hong Kong, befriended the dentist and lured him into investing in crypto with a promise that he'd get three times returns, police said. This is first such case in Chhattisgarh, police added.

54.title: Russian troops no different from terrorists: Ukraine Prez
54.article_body: The actions of Russian troops were no different from terrorists such as Daesh, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy while addressing UNSC on Tuesday. "Russia's actions in Ukraine have resulted in the most terrible war crimes of all times we have seen since the end of World War II," he added. He further demanded that Russia be expelled from UNSC.

55.title: Karthik came in and just took the game away: RR's Riyan on defeat
55.article_body: Talking about their first defeat in three games this season, RR batter Riyan Parag said RCB's Dinesh Karthik came in to bat and took the game away from them. "I don't think we made a lot of mistakes...I just feel they were better on the given day," he added. RCB chased down RR's 169-run total with five balls to spare.

56.title: Next project is controversial; it'll be more violent than Squid Game: Director
56.article_body: Director Hwang Dong-hyuk, who directed the Korean language series 'Squid Game', said he is working on a film titled 'Killing Old People Club'. Hwang added that he has already penned a 25-page treatment about 'Killing Old People Club' which is bound to be "another controversial" project.  The director further said that the film will be more violent than 'Squid Game'.

57.title: IIT-D, Delhi Jal Board sign MoU to address water security issues
57.article_body: Indian Institute of Technology-Delhi (IIT-D) and Delhi Jal Board (DJB) have signed an MoU to address issues related to water security in national capital. As part of MoU, both sides will work on identifying research and development initiatives in water supply and distribution, wastewater conveyance, recycling and disposal. They will also develop Smart Operation and Management framework for DJB.

58.title: CNG price in Delhi hiked by ₹2.5 per kg, to now cost ₹66.61 per kg
58.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Wednesday. CNG will now cost ₹66.61 per kg in the national capital. For Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad, the CNG price has been hiked to ₹69.18 per kg. In Gurugram, it has been hiked to ₹74.94 per kg.

59.title: People think he's a skinny guy, can't hit: Plessis on Shahbaz Ahmed's 45(26)
59.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis praised all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed for his 45-run innings against RR, stating that the 27-year-old will play a "long part" this season. "People think since Shahbaz is a small skinny guy, he can't hit it long but he can smash it a long way," added Plessis. Shahbaz smashed 3 sixes and 4 fours in his innings.

60.title: Voice votes taken 200 times during passage of CA Bill in Rajya Sabha
60.article_body: Rajya Sabha saw voice votes being taken over 200 times for passage of a Bill on Chartered Accountants (CAs) on Tuesday. The debate on the Bill, including FM Nirmala Sitharaman's reply, took about two hours and 20 minutes and the process of voting took over 30 minutes. There were 106 clauses and clause-wise amendments in the Bill.

61.title: Eye-witness in Cong councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case found dead in WB
61.article_body: An eye-witness in Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case was found dead on Wednesday in West Bengal's Purulia, police said. He was found hanging from the ceiling in his house, police added. The deceased left a note which stated, "I've been under mental stress since the day I saw Tapan's death...mental stress is aggravated by the repeated calls from police."

62.title: Told myself 'you'll go doing what you love': Tanuj on 'near-death experience'
62.article_body: Actor Tanuj Virwani said he felt "close to death" while filming underwater sequence during shoot for Abhay 3. "[Divya Agarwal] would be all 'We got this bro'...I would say yeah but in my head...I was thinking...'I don't know what's happening'...I just told myself, 'If this is how you have to go...at least you'll go doing something you love'," he added.

63.title: UK claims to have frozen $350 billion of Putin's war chest
63.article_body: British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said that the UK has frozen $350 billion of Russian President Vladimir Putin's war chest following the attack on Ukraine. "Our sanctions have had a crippling impact on those who feed and fund Putin's war machine," she said during her Poland visit. She added the sanctions are hurting the Russian economy.

64.title: Trump's supporters urge Musk to bring him back on Twitter
64.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's supporters are urging Tesla CEO Elon Musk to reinstate Trump's Twitter account after Musk became Twitter's largest shareholder. "Now that...Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder, it's time to lift...political censorship. Oh...and BRING BACK TRUMP!" Republican Lauren Boebert tweeted. Trump was permanently banned from Twitter following the US Capitol riot in 2021.

65.title: Mumbai gets its first transgender toilet in Goregaon
65.article_body: Mumbai's first public toilet exclusively built for the LGBTQ community has been set up in the Goregaon area. The project aims to provide a safe space for transgenders and prevent gender discrimination against them. "We request the government to construct more toilets like this one in other areas of the city," an LGBTQ member Manju, said while welcoming the move.

66.title: Electricity charges to increase in Bengaluru as KERC hikes tariff
66.article_body: The electricity charges for people living in Bengaluru will now increase as the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC) announced a 35-paise-per-unit increase in electricity tariffs for the next fiscal year (2022-23). "Against the demand of ₹1.85/unit by electric supply companies, the commission has increased the tariff by five paise per unit," Commission Chairman HM Manjunatha said.

67.title: Court denies bail to Jamia student in Northeast Delhi riots case
67.article_body: A Delhi court has denied bail to Jamia Millia Islamia student Meeran Haider in connection with a case related to 2020 Northeast Delhi riots. Haider, who is a Rashtriya Janata Dal youth wing leader, was charged under UAPA and sections of IPC. There are reasonable grounds for believing that the accusation against him is prima facie true, the court ruled.

68.title: Residents dump sewer waste at councillor’s office over inaction in Ludhiana
68.article_body: The residents of Ludhiana's Manjit Nagar dumped sewer waste in the office of Ward 47 Congress councillor Priya Kaira alleging inaction over multiple complaints. They were protesting against choked sewer lines in the area, which they claim had not been cleared out in four years. "One cannot even move through the streets due to the accumulated wastewater," a protestor claimed.

69.title: Amid Azaan row, B'luru Police starts seizing mics from places of worship
69.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around using loudspeakers for Azaan, Bengaluru Police have started seizing microphones from places of worship that allegedly defied noise pollution orders of court. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said that the police have booked cases and that the drive will continue to keep a check on prescribed decibel levels. He also said action will be initiated.

70.title: Had 4 months of training, spent 4-5 hrs a day playing cricket: Shahid on Jersey
70.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he underwent four months of training for his upcoming film 'Jersey'. "We started in Bombay and began playing on hard surfaces. We started with throwdowns. I used to spend four-five hours a day playing cricket for four months and then [a lot] on set [too]," he added.

71.title: Vidya would say a line, go to a room and have tears: Director on 'Jalsa' scene
71.article_body: 'Jalsa' director Suresh Triveni said that actress Vidya Balan cried after filming a scene that involved her yelling at her on-screen son. "Every time Vidya would say that line...she'll...come near the monitor, go inside a room...she would have tears...I remember when I met Surya later after the shoot, and the first thing he said was 'Vidya ma'am cried," Suresh added.

72.title: Karthik shifted momentum our way, it made it easy for me: Shahbaz
72.article_body: RCB all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who scored 45 off 26 against RR, has said the wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik shifted the momentum in the game with his 23-ball 44-run innings and it also made it easy for him to bat. "The situation was a little tough because the momentum was with RR...But DK bhai shifted the momentum," he stated.

73.title: 48,000 mask-less Punekars penalised, ₹1.90 crore fine collected in 2 yrs
73.article_body: Over 48,000 people were penalised for flouting COVID-19 mask rules in the last two years in Pune. Reports said that ₹1.90 crore fine was collected in two years. The penalties included people who were caught spitting on the roads. Officials said that the highest imposed penalty during the pandemic for these offences went up to as high as ₹1,000.

74.title: Hrithik, rumoured girlfriend Saba party with Sussanne and Arslan in Goa, pics surface
74.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partied together with Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni in Goa. Pooja Bedi shared pictures from the party, which also saw Sussanne’s siblings Farah Khan Ali and Zayed Khan in attendance. Hrithik and Sussanne had tied the knot in 2000 and had separated in 2014.

75.title: Am I Vijay Mallya or Nirav or Ambani, Adani: Raut mocks ED for attaching his property
75.article_body: After ED attached Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's properties in a ₹1,034-crore land scam case, he mocked the agency, saying, "Understand the meaning of property. Am I Vijay Mallya, am I Mehul Choksi?" "Am I Nirav Modi or Ambani, Adani? I live in a small house. I don't have a single acre of land in my native place," he added.

76.title: 24-yr-old Army aspirant runs 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi, clip goes viral
76.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian Army aspirant named Suresh Bhichar ran 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi. "I have come from Rajasthan's Nagaur district. I have a passion to join the Indian Army," he said. He added, "Recruitment hasn't taken place for 2 years. I have come to Delhi by running to increase the enthusiasm of youth."

77.title: China reports 20,472 daily COVID-19 cases, highest since start of pandemic
77.article_body: China reported 20,472 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, the highest daily tally since the start of the pandemic. Shanghai remains the hotspot for the current surge, despite a sweeping lockdown of its 25 million people. There were 311 local infections and 16,766 asymptomatic cases in Shanghai, and another 973 infections and 1,798 asymptomatic cases in Jilin, a northeastern province.

78.title: Pak PM's wife's friend flees amid corruption charges; her '$90,000-bag' pic goes viral
78.article_body: A friend of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi has reportedly fled to Dubai amid allegations of corruption. A photo of Farah Khan travelling in luxury, with a bag near her feet, surfaced on Twitter, however, its date isn't clear. "The bag with her is for $90,000," Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz Member Romina Khurshid Alam tweeted, sharing the picture.

79.title: Railways to begin Bengaluru to Tumakuru MEMU train services from April 8
79.article_body: The South Western Railways will run Mainline Electric Multiple Unit (MEMU) trains on Bengaluru-Tumakuru line from April 8 to facilitate office-goers, officials said. "The train will leave from Tumakuru at 11:15 am and arrive at Krantivira Sangolli Rayanna at 1:25 pm and depart from KSR at 1:50 pm and arrive at Tumakuru at 3:40 pm," a Railways officer informed.

80.title: Congress, that imposed Emergency, is crying for democracy today: Shah
80.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the House over the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, said, "Congress, the party which imposed the Emergency, snatched all democratic rights, sent Opposition behind bars for no reason, strangled freedom of the press, and censored Kishore Kumar's songs, is crying for democracy today." He added that those who forget history, become history.

81.title: Criminal arrested with AK-47, 1,300 cartridges in UP's Shamli
81.article_body: Shamli Police in UP arrested a man from the Thanabhawan area and recovered an AK-47 rifle along with 1,300 rounds of cartridges which the accused bought for ₹11 lakh. He is a member of 'Anil Banji’ gang. "The arrested criminal is being interrogated to know how a weapon like AK-47 was smuggled and from where," Shamli SP, Sukirti Madhav, said.

82.title: Haryana CM Khattar withdraws VVIP number series from his convoy
82.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced the withdrawal of VVIP number series 0001 of four vehicles of his convoy. All the numbers will be available for the general public through e-auction, he added. "A revenue of ₹18 crore will be earned through e-auctioning...The money can be used for the welfare of the public," Khattar stated.

83.title: 2 arrested for assaulting, looting BSF sub-inspector in Gurugram
83.article_body: Two men were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly assaulting and looting a BSF sub-inspector. According to DCP Virender Vij, the suspects had offered a lift to sub-inspector Arvind Bagaria to drop him to Delhi. However, when they reached near Guru Dronacharya Metro station, one of the suspects moved to the back seat, assaulted Bagaria and looted his luggage, police added.

84.title: 5 domestic workers steal cash, jewels from employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana
84.article_body: Five domestic workers reportedly fled with cash and valuables worth lakhs from their employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana's Sarabha Nagar Extension while they were on a pilgrimage. "The accused...broke open the iron grill and glass of the store...broke the safes and stole cash...gold and silver jewels," the complainant said. According to police, the businessman had hired them two years ago.

85.title: New range of Hitachi split ACs comes with ambience light feature & Wi-Fi
85.article_body: Hitachi's new range of split ACs with advanced Japanese technology are unique and inspired by nature, stated the brand. The ACs are equipped with an immersive display called ambience light, which turns blue at a temperature of 16-23℃  indicating cool ambience, green at 24-27℃ for comfort and red at 28-32℃ to indicate warm ambience.

86.title: Gadkari, Raut, Maha MLAs attend dinner at Sharad Pawar's home in Delhi
86.article_body: BJP leader Nitin Gadkari, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut and Maharashtra MLAs attended dinner at NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Delhi. Pawar invited Maharashtra MLAs for the dinner, as the leaders from all the parties are in Delhi for a training program in Parliament. The MLAs also attended a tea party at Raut's residence in the evening.

87.title: I can't point out one moment where we lost the game vs RCB: Sanju Samson
87.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said he can't point out "one moment" where they lost the game against RCB on Tuesday night. "I thought it was a great effort to put up that total on such a slow wicket...Jos and Hetmyer batted brilliantly at the death," he added. This was RR's first loss in three games so far in the tournament.

88.title: Pune University students to get training as tour guides at Buddhist sites
88.article_body: Students at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will get training and on-field experience of working as tour guides at Buddhist archaeological sites. The Department of Archaeology and Museums, Pune has agreed to provide training to students enrolled in postgraduate diploma course of Buddhist Heritage and Tourism. About 10 students in the first batch will be doing a three-month internship.

89.title: Man forces lover to sell house, threatens to leak intimate videos in Pune
89.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has lodged an FIR with Pune Police, stating her father's friend who was in relationship with her since 2012, forced her to sell her house and siphoned off money. She also stated that he made videos of their intimate moments and later used them for blackmailing her. The accused reportedly threatened to post videos on social media.

90.title: Germany sees surge in distribution of images of child sex abuse
90.article_body: Although overall crime rate fell in Germany in 2021 compared to previous year, the country witnessed a 108.8% surge in distribution of images of child sex abuse, said the government on Tuesday. "Combating sexual abuse of children and dissemination of heinous abuse photos and videos via the internet is a top priority," said German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser.

91.title: Being in the industry can take a toll; you need to have perfect skin: Priyamani
91.article_body:
'The Family Man' actress Priyamani said being in the industry can take a toll on an artiste. 
"You need to have perfect skin, dress, and hair because you'll be photographed at any time. Although people need to know that it's just for half an hour," she said. "It's okay to have imperfections. It's absolutely normal to have flaws," she added.

92.title: No state reported confirmed death due to oxygen shortage during COVID: Govt
92.article_body: Union Minister of State for Health Bharati Pawar on Tuesday told the Parliament that no state or UT has confirmed any death due to a shortage of oxygen during the COVID-19 pandemic. "Of the total, 20 states and UTs have responded but none of them reported confirmed death due to oxygen shortage," Bharati added.

93.title: 4 leopard cubs rescued and reunited with their mother in Pune
93.article_body: Four leopard cubs, found in a sugarcane field in Kabadwadi village of Pune, were reunited with their mother by forest department officials. The cubs, including two male and two female, were spotted by farmers while harvesting cane in the village. After medical examination the cubs were placed in a safe box from where their mother took them away, officials added.

94.title: 167 accidents, 78 deaths recorded on Pune roads in last three months
94.article_body: Pune traffic police have recorded 167 accidents in city between January and March 2022. Meanwhile, in same period of time, deaths of 78 people in road accidents have also been recorded. Reports said highest number of deaths were recorded in areas under Sinhgad road traffic police division. Police data said that there are 19 accident-prone black spots in the city.

95.title: KTR inaugurates 1st facility of Jamp Pharma outside Canada in Hyderabad
95.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Tuesday inaugurated the first facility of Jamp Pharmaceuticals outside Canada in Genome Valley in Hyderabad. "The facility is designed to cater solid oral dosage form, powders, topicals, nasal delivery and liquid oral pharmaceutical products for regulated markets," he tweeted. "The facility is being established with a total investment of ₹250 crore," KTR added.

96.title: SC stays order barring Arya Samaj from issuing marriage certificates
96.article_body: The Supreme Court stayed a Madhya Pradesh High Court order which asked Arya Samaj to follow provisions under Special Marriages Act for weddings and barred it from issuing marriage certificates. The petitioners challenging the high court order argued that Arya Samaj had been solemnising weddings according to Vedic rituals for over a century before the Hindu personal laws were enacted.

97.title: If you sing 'dirty lyrics', Punjab people won't let you eat at dhabas: Jasbir
97.article_body: Singer Jasbir Jassi said that he can't sing 'dirty lyrics' of songs. "Punjabis will beat me up. The atmosphere in Punjab today is such that if you sing really dirty lyrics, people won't let you even eat at dhabas," he said, adding, "I owe it to Punjab...I have to take Punjab and move forward, we are connected to our roots."

98.title: 3 persons held in Ahmedabad for cheating job aspirants of ₹3 cr
98.article_body: Ahmedabad Police’s Crime Branch team arrested three persons and busted a racket that allegedly cheated 81 people to the tune of ₹3.24 crore by promising them government jobs. Police recovered several application forms, exam admit cards, police ID cards, uniforms, gadgets and cash from them. The accused gang had created a specific rate chart of “assured postings in government jobs".

99.title: Intel suspends all operations in Russia, calls for 'return to peace'
99.article_body: Intel has announced the suspension of all its operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. "Intel continues to join the global community in condemning Russia's war against Ukraine and calling for a swift return to peace," the firm said. It added that it's working to support all of its employees through the conflict, including its 1,200 employees in Russia.

100.title: Getting rid of spam higher priority: Binance CEO on Musk's Twitter poll
100.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao in response to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter edit button poll said, "Getting rid of spam is probably [a] higher priority. Protect users." Earlier, Musk had posted a poll asking his followers if they wanted an edit button. Last year, Zhao and Musk argued on Twitter after Musk called Binance's handling of its Dogecoin glitch "shady".

101.title: Sonia Gandhi meets Congress MLAs from Maharashtra in Delhi
101.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday met with a delegation of around 22 party MLAs from Maharashtra at her residence in Delhi. The MLAs reportedly expressed concern over lack of coordination within the Congress legislature party. "The meeting held with Sonia Gandhi was based on present political situation of Maharashtra and how to strengthen the party," said MLA Vikas Thakre.

102.title: I was unable to move my hand, took painkiller injection: Rishabh Pant on Sydney Test
102.article_body: Recalling the Sydney Test in India's 2-1 Test series victory over Australia in 2020-21, Rishabh Pant said he injured his elbow in the first innings and was unable to move his hand. He added that he took a painkiller injection as he had to bat "by hook or by crook". Pant scored 97 runs in the second innings.

103.title: I am not done yet: RCB's Dinesh Karthik after scoring 44*(23) against RR
103.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 44 off 23 deliveries to help RCB defeat RR, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "I've made a conscious effort this year to do justice to myself because last year...I felt I could've done better." He added, "I'm making a conscious effort to tell myself that I'm not done yet." The 36-year-old was named 'Player of the Match'.

104.title: Elon Musk refiles Twitter stake disclosure to show he's an active investor
104.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk refiled the disclosure of his stake in Twitter to classify himself as an active investor, after he was appointed to the company's board. Earlier, he had filed a disclosure showing a passive stake of over 9% in Twitter, meaning he wouldn't seek change at the company. His stake ownership makes him Twitter's largest shareholder.

105.title: Heat wave warning issued for 12 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
105.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for 12 states and UTs over five days. Heat wave to severe heat wave conditions are likely over Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh, Jammu and Himachal Pradesh. Maharashtra may witness heat wave from April 5 to 7. Gujarat, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and Bihar are likely to witness heat wave today.

106.title: Policeman records video of woman taking bath in Gurugram, suspended
106.article_body: A head constable of Gurugram Police has been suspended for allegedly recording a video of a woman while she was taking a bath, police said. The incident took place on April 3 when the accused passed by carrying a bucket, police added. "There is no ceiling between bathrooms. He was recording a video from an adjacent bathroom," the woman said.

107.title: Civilian killings in Ukraine's Bucha disturbing, need independent probe: India at UNSC
107.article_body: At the UNSC meeting on Ukraine addressed by Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, India's TS Tirumurti said, "Recent reports of civilian killings in Bucha are deeply disturbing. We unequivocally condemn these killings and support the call for an independent investigation." UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said he will never forget the "horrifying images of civilians killed in Bucha".

108.title: India reports 1,086 new COVID-19 cases, 71 deaths in 24 hours
108.article_body: India has reported 1,086 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,198 recoveries, and 71 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 71 deaths reported today, 63 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,871, while the death toll reached 5,21,487.

109.title: Twitter confirms it's working on an edit button, says 'we weren't joking' on April 1
109.article_body: Twitter has confirmed that it's been working on an edit feature since last year and it will test the feature with Twitter Blue members in coming months. It said that it didn't get the idea from a poll by Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder. "Ps: we weren't joking," Twitter said about its April 1 "working on an edit button" tweet.

110.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa revokes state of Emergency
110.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa late on Tuesday night revoked the state of Emergency with immediate effect on his island nation. This comes after Rajapaksa's ruling coalition lost its majority in Parliament as proceedings began on Tuesday and at least 41 lawmakers walked out of the alliance. Notably, Finance Minister Ali Sabry resigned a day after his appointment on Tuesday.

111.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 14th time in 16 days
111.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 14th time in 16 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹105.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹96.67/litre from ₹95.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹120.51/litre from ₹119.67/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹104.77/litre from ₹103.92/litre.

112.title: Loved her for many years, it's not gonna change: Shawn on ex-girlfriend Camila
112.article_body: Speaking about his ex-girlfriend, singer Shawn Mendes said he has loved Camila for so many years and that's never gonna change. When asked where he stands with Camila, Shawn said the two are still "so friendly". He added that a breakup may be a "blessing" since it can really show you that you are [strong enough] to go through it.

113.title: Pune family arranges ₹1 lakh chopper ride for newborn daughter, video surfaces
113.article_body: A family arranged a chopper ride worth ₹1 lakh to bring home their newborn girl child in Pune's Shelgaon. A video shows the family members welcoming the child in traditional attire as the chopper landed. The girl's father, Vishal Zarekar said, "We did not have a girl child in our entire family."

114.title: Mumbai hospital suspends ward boy for breaching patient's privacy
114.article_body: Dr LH Hiranandani Hospital in Mumbai's Powai has suspended a ward boy for a week for allegedly breaching a 35-year-old writer's privacy when she was undergoing ECG. The victim claimed the ward boy entered the cubicle when the procedure was underway last week. A three-member committee concluded he had no mala fide intent and will undergo extensive patient care training.

115.title: Heatwave in Delhi may get severe, to continue for next 6 days: IMD
115.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi is predicted to become more severe as no relief is in sight for at least six days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Tuesday. Delhi's maximum temperature is expected to touch the 40°C mark on Wednesday and rise to 42°C by Friday. Prolonged dry spell responsible for Delhi's "severe" heatwave, IMD officials said.

116.title: We missed T Natarajan in T20 World Cup 2021: Ravi Shastri
116.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the team missed T Natarajan in the T20 World Cup 2021. "He would've been a certainty had he been fit. He got injured against England when we were playing the ODI series and we really missed him," Shastri said. He added, "Natarajan...bowls...yorkers very skilfully. He has got great control."

117.title: RCB score 104 runs in last 55 balls, hand RR their first defeat in IPL 2022
117.article_body: RCB handed RR their first defeat in IPL 2022 after beating them by four wickets on Tuesday. RR put up a total of 169/3, with Jos Buttler scoring 70*(47). RCB, who were 69/4 after 10 overs, went on to chase down the target in 19.1 overs, scoring 173/6. RCB's Shahbaz Ahmed scored 45(26), while Dinesh Karthik scored 44*(23).

118.title: Czech Republic sends tanks to Ukraine in latest military aid
118.article_body: The Czech Republic has sent tanks and infantry fighting vehicles to Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a Czech source. Several NATO countries have responded to Ukraine's request for military aid to fight Russian forces invading the country. NATO allies will discuss the delivery of more weapons to Ukraine when Foreign Ministers meet on Wednesday and Thursday, Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said.

119.title: US, UK & Australia plan to develop hypersonic missiles under AUKUS
119.article_body: A US official said that the US, the UK and Australia plan to work together via their security alliance known as AUKUS to develop hypersonic missiles. The move comes amid growing concern by the US and allies about China's growing military assertiveness in the Pacific, a report said. In October, the US said China had tested a hypersonic weapon system.

120.title: Kohli should bat with open stance initially to counter inswingers: Akram
120.article_body: After observing Virat Kohli's form in IPL 2022 so far, Wasim Akram said RCB batter should play with an open stance in first couple of overs to negotiate the inswinging deliveries. He added that Kohli should play with a straight bat if he's struggling against left-armers. Akram further said that Kohli would be unstoppable if he survives first two overs.

121.title: Asiatic lions facing challenges, need human-free area: Cong MP
121.article_body: Raising the issue of need for human-free areas for Asiatic lions, Congress MP Rajani Patil told Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that lions are "facing...lot of challenges because...protected forest areas are shared by human population", adding, Gujarat's Gir forest has only 250 sq km of human-free area. She also claimed the Gujarat government is "reluctant" to implement scientific counting of lions.

122.title: Apple to host Worldwide Developers Conference virtually from June 6-10
122.article_body: Apple announced that it will host its annual Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) in an online format from June 6-10. It will be the third year in a row that the event will be hosted virtually. WWDC is a software-focused event where Apple unveils new iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch software. Apple is expected to unveil iOS 16 for iPhone this year.

123.title: Finland and Sweden welcome to join NATO: Secretary General
123.article_body: Finland and Sweden would be welcomed in NATO by member countries if the two Nordic nations decided to join the alliance, Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said. Last Month, a Russian official had said that military and political consequences may follow if the two countries join NATO. Tensions between Russia and the West are high over the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

124.title: WB's state would've been worse had it been a country: WB BJP chief
124.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Dr Sukanta Kumar Majumdar on Tuesday said that the state's condition would've been worse than Sri Lanka had it been a separate country. "Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee should take care of her state. Sri Lanka is ruined; its total debt was ₹6 lakh crore and West Bengal's debt is ₹5.62 lakh crore," he further said.

125.title: Seems CPI(M) forced Naseeruddin to record video appeal for niece: Babul
125.article_body: After actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a video appealing to people to vote for his niece and CPI(M) candidate Saira Shah Halim in bypoll to Bengal's Ballygunge seat, TMC leader Babul Supriyo said it seemed that he was forced to record the video. "We all love and respect Naseeruddin Shah...but sadly he looks very gloomy in this video," Supriyo tweeted.

126.title: Girl named 'Madhu's 5th child' enrolled to UP school as CMO intervenes
126.article_body: A girl, whose Aadhaar card named her as 'Baby Five of Madhu', was admitted to a government school in UP's Budaun after CMO intervened. "The teacher made fun of name mentioned on my daughter's Aadhaar card...and didn't admit her there," her mother claimed. An official said she was enrolled on April 2 and a correction was suggested for her Aadhaar.

127.title: Centre's reply sought on alleged gender bias in Hindu Succession Act
127.article_body: SC on Tuesday gave Centre four weeks' time to reply to a plea, alleging that Sections 15 and 16 of the Hindu Succession Act, 1956, violate gender equality. The plea said a dead Hindu woman's husband's family gets priority in inheritance before her own parents. However, when a man dies, his property is distributed among his heirs, including his parents.

128.title: Looking forward to learning the most from Younis Khan: Rashid
128.article_body: Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan, who is currently playing in IPL 2022, said he's looking forward to learning the most from newly-appointed Afghanistan batting coach Younis Khan. Along with Younis, Umar Gul was appointed as bowling coach ahead of upcoming preparatory camp in UAE. Afghanistan's 25-member squad is set to leave for Abu Dhabi to get through their UAE citizenship process.

129.title: 'This is what 80-20 meant': AAP leader on BJP amid rise in fuel prices
129.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh on Tuesday said that BJP's '80-20' remark meant that it would increase petrol and diesel prices by 80 paise each for 20 consecutive days. "During the entire election in Uttar Pradesh, the BJP kept saying that we are contesting on 80-20," he said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath made the remark in January.

130.title: 4 members of a gang who posed as policemen to loot people held in UP
130.article_body: Four members of an inter-state looter's gang, the Irani Gang, who posed as policemen to loot people, were arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Tuesday, police said. A Satish Ganesh, Commissioner of Police (Varanasi), said that gold jewellery, ₹58,000 in cash, two country-made pistols, a four-wheeler were recovered from their possession. Around 6kg of marijuana was also recovered, he added.

131.title: OnePlus 10 Pro, Bullets Wireless Z2 & Buds Pro Radiant Silver go on sale
131.article_body: OnePlus begins open sale for OnePlus 10 Pro, Bullets Wireless Z2 and Buds Pro Radiant Silver starting 5 April across OnePlus.in, OnePlus Store app, OnePlus exclusive offline stores, Amazon.in, and all partner outlets. OnePlus 10 Pro will be available in two colors, Volcanic Black and Emerald Forest, starting at ₹66,999 for 8GB/128GB variant and ₹71,999 for 12GB/256GB variant.

132.title: Deeply concerned over economic crisis in Sri Lanka: US
132.article_body: The US on Tuesday said that it's deeply concerned over Sri Lanka's economic crisis and urged authorities to exercise constraint. "We urge authorities to...avoid social media blackouts and arrests under the Prevention of Terrorism Act," US State Department official Ned Price tweeted. Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items, including medicines, and rolling power cuts.

133.title: Party that censored Kishore's songs is crying for democracy: Shah on Cong
133.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, criticised the Congress saying, "The party which imposed the Emergency...censored Kishore Kumar's songs is crying for democracy today?" Shah was speaking on the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022. "Those who forget history, become history. I can see it in the House before me," Shah added.

134.title: Middleman arrested after complaint on Punjab's graft helpline
134.article_body: A middleman, allegedly engaged by a patwari, was arrested by the vigilance bureau in Punjab's Ferozepur for taking a ₹1,000 bribe. The patwari had demanded a bribe to do the mutation of a piece of land bought by the complainant, police said. The complainant, however, recorded a video while paying the bribe and sent it to the newly-launched anti-corruption helpline.

135.title: Protestors 'exceeded fundamental right to peacefully protest': Court
135.article_body: A Delhi Court on Tuesday denied bail to the protestors, who targeted Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's house and said that the accused exceeded the "fundamental right to peacefully protest". The court said that while the right to assemble and protest is a fundamental one, "such a right is subject to certain restrictions and is not an uncontrolled one".

136.title: Latvia & Estonia to close 4 Russian consulates amid Ukraine war
136.article_body: Latvia and Estonia have ordered the closure of four Russian consulates and expulsion of their respective staff amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the countries' foreign ministries said on Tuesday. Consulates in Latvia's Daugavpils and Liepaja and Estonia's Tartu and Narva will close by end of April. Lithuania expelled Russian Ambassador and downgraded diplomatic ties with the country on Monday.

137.title: Haryana a tenant in Chandigarh, should get own capital: Ex-min Dalal
137.article_body: Terming the ongoing dispute between Haryana and Punjab governments over capital Chandigarh as 'ghisa pita' (stale), former Haryana minister Karan Dalal on Monday said the issue is being used to mislead public. He added, Haryana should think of creating a new capital. "For...last 55 years, Haryana...occupied Chandigarh as a tenant...now it's time to think about...independent capital," Dalal said.

138.title: Individuals can use UPI for public issue payments of up to ₹5 lakh
138.article_body: SEBI on Tuesday said individual investors applying in public issues of equity shares can use UPI for application amount of up to ₹5 lakh from May 1 onwards. Investors have also been asked to provide their UPI ID in the bid-cum-application form. National Payments Corporation of India had increased per transaction limit in UPI to ₹5 lakh in December 2021.

139.title: Milk prices to stay firm, can only go up from here: Amul MD
139.article_body: Milk prices will remain firm and can only increase from their current rates, Amul MD RS Sodhi said. Inflation in the milk industry isn't a concern as farmers' profits have increased due to hike in prices, he added. Amul is not affected by increased pressure from energy, logistics and packaging costs as profit-making is not Amul's core objective, Sodhi said.

140.title: 'KGF 2' was the first offer I got from the South: Sanjay Dutt
140.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said 'KGF: Chapter 2' is the first-ever South Indian film that was offered to him. "I don't know why (I was never approached before)," he stated. Sanjay added he "instantly" said yes to the film when the role of Adheera was offered to him. "This character is as strong as Kancha Cheena was in 'Agneepath'," he said.

141.title: Fuel shortage at Russia's embassy in Ireland in backlash over invasion
141.article_body: The Russian embassy in Ireland has complained of a shortage of fuel after its provider refused to deliver diesel. Calling for the Irish government to intervene "into this clearly discriminatory case", the embassy said that other providers had "refused to cooperate". Reportedly, this is a backlash against the invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

142.title: I feel betrayed: Chirag Paswan on eviction from Delhi bungalow
142.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party leader Chirag Paswan has said he felt "betrayed" and "humiliated" by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. He said, "I don't feel bad about losing...house" adding that he objects to the way in which it was done. "[We'd] never think of claiming [the house]," he added.

143.title: Pregnant Anganwadi worker dies of electrocution in MP's Bhopal
143.article_body: A 29-year-old Anganwadi worker, who was four months pregnant, died after being electrocuted in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday. According to her family members, she received an electric shock after accidentally touching a nearby cooler while washing clothes, following which she was rushed to hospital. She was, however, declared dead after being shifted to another hospital for better treatment.

144.title: It is a time to give chance to AAP in Himachal Pradesh: Jain
144.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said that people are tired of BJP and Congress, adding that "now it's time to give a chance to the AAP" in Himachal Pradesh. Jain said, "AAP is dedicated to public welfare, while other political leaders are busy ensuring their personal welfare." AAP will contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections.

145.title: 3 tigers found dead in last 3 days in Madhya Pradesh jungles
145.article_body: At least three tigers have been found dead in two forests of Madhya Pradesh in last three days, forest officials said on Monday. Officials found a carcass of five-month-old cub at Satpura Tiger Reserve on Saturday, while they found another injured tiger nearby, who later succumbed to injuries. In Balaghat forest area, tiger died due to territorial fight on Sunday.

146.title: Actress Tejasswi Prakash buys Audi Q7 worth ₹1 crore, pics surface
146.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash bought an Audi Q7, which is worth ₹1 crore, on Tuesday. Pinkvilla's official Instagram handle shared pictures of Tejasswi and her boyfriend Karan Kundrra in the Audi showroom. Reacting to the post, Karan commented, "It's Tejasswi's car...I was only the ghar ka (personal) videographer." Several fans congratulated Tejasswi for buying the car.

147.title: Kamal & I were almost arrested in US during Vishwaroopam shoot: Jaideep
147.article_body: Jaideep Ahlawat recalled an incident from the shooting of 'Vishwaroopam' on a bridge in the US where he and Kamal Haasan were almost arrested. Jaideep said there were "8-10" police cars for them when he and Kamal reached the toll in their third round trip. "Cops started yelling...I was thinking...'Please don't shoot'," he stated. "They realised it's...film shoot," Jaideep added.

148.title: Who are India's 10 richest people according to Forbes' latest rich list?
148.article_body: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person with $90.7 billion wealth as of March 11, Forbes' latest rich list released on Tuesday stated. Gautam Adani is second-richest in India with $90 billion wealth, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar ($28.7 billion) and Cyrus Poonawalla ($24.3 billion). DMart's Radhakishan Damani is fifth-richest in India with $20 billion wealth and Lakshmi Mittal sixth-richest.

149.title: Rashmika Mandanna joins actor Vijay in 'Thalapathy 66'
149.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has joined actor Vijay for his upcoming film that is tentatively titled 'Thalapathy 66'. The makers of the film made the announcement on Rashmika's 26th birthday. Taking to Twitter, the makers wrote, "Wishing the talented and gorgeous Rashmika a very Happy Birthday! Welcome onboard." The film will be directed by Vamshi Paidipally.

150.title: RR have best bowling attack in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
150.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said RR, who are currently at top of IPL standings, have best bowling attack in the tournament this year. "They have a well-rounded attack and have a lot of wicket-taking options," he added. Jaffer further said that RR are first team in IPL 2022 that have lost the toss in both the matches and won them.

151.title: Civilians crushed with tanks for Russians' pleasure: Zelenskyy tells UN
151.article_body: Likening Russia's actions in Ukraine to that of terrorist organisations such as the Islamic State, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the UNSC to "act immediately" or shut down. Talking about Russian atrocities in Bucha, he said, "Civilians were crushed by tanks while sitting in their cars...just for their pleasure...Women were raped and killed in front of their children."

152.title: Not an inch of India's land ceded since Modi became PM: Rijiju
152.article_body: Not an inch of land has been ceded since Narendra Modi became Prime Minister, Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Everyone knows that our claimed territory under the control of China and Pakistan dates back to earlier times. I don't want to take anyone's name," Rijiju further said.

153.title: Probe ordered after video shows UP man taking wife to hospital on cart
153.article_body: A probe was ordered by Uttar Pradesh's Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak on Tuesday, a day after a video showed a man taking his wife to a hospital on a hand cart in Ballia district. The woman died on the same night during treatment, said Ballia Chief Medical Officer (CMO) Neeraj Pandey.

154.title: Builder Sanjay Biyani shot dead outside his house in Maha; incident caught on CCTV
154.article_body: Builder Sanjay Biyani was shot dead by unknown assailants at his residence in Maharashtra's Nanded in broad daylight on Tuesday. A CCTV footage of the incident has also surfaced online, showing the accused men, who came on a two-wheeler, shooting at him. Police said that it looks like a planned attack on the builder.

155.title: Use influence to mediate Russia-Ukraine truce: Tharoor to govt
155.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that the Indian government should use its influence to mediate a truce between Russia and Ukraine amid the conflict. India should not shy away from taking a morally correct position in line with its foreign policy, he added. Separately, Tharoor also expressed concern about the emerging Russia-China-Pakistan axis.

156.title: Nadal not jealous about Alcaraz, he knows Miami winner is great: Corretja
156.article_body: Comparing Spaniards Rafael Nadal and Carlos Alcaraz, who recently won his first ATP 1000 Masters title in Miami, ex-world number two Alex Corretja said he's hopeful that soon 18-year-old will be close to 21-time Grand Slam champion. "Rafael isn't jealous of Alcaraz. He knows...Alcaraz is great," he added. Alcaraz became third youngest 1000 Masters winner after Michael Chang and Nadal.

157.title: McLaren receive FIA Environmental Accreditation for 9th straight year
157.article_body: Formula One team McLaren on Monday said they have received the FIA's three-star Environmental Accreditation for the ninth consecutive year since 2013. "McLaren Racing has a legacy of sustainable leadership, and we recognize our responsibility to provide solutions to sustainability challenges through our people, operations and practices," McLaren's Director of Sustainability Kim Wilson said.

158.title: Worked hard for BJP, had aspiration for promotion: Babul Supriyo
158.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo revealed on Tuesday that he had previously "retired hurt from politics" as his "aspirations for promotion" in BJP didn't work out. "I felt that PM Modi...didn't have regard for knowledge...I worked hard for BJP since 2014," he added. Supriyo will contest as TMC's candidate for West Bengal Assembly by-polls from the Ballygunge seat.

159.title: 42 militants killed in last 3 months in J&K: DGP Dilbag Singh
159.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that 42 militants were killed in 2022 so far and further vowed to intensify counter-insurgency measures in the valley. This comes after a CRPF personnel martyred in a militant attack on Monday in Srinagar. "This...won't be tolerated," Singh said as he participated in the wreath-laying ceremony of the CRPF personnel today.

160.title: Not worth his life: Sahil Shah shares post after delivery boy suffers breakdown
160.article_body: Comedian Sahil Shah took to Twitter after he witnessed a delivery agent breakdown as he had suffered three accidents while trying to deliver his food. Shah said he gave him a good tip and apologised to him as his dinner shouldn't be "worth his life". He further advised people to be nice to their delivery agents and respect them.

161.title: At this point of time yes: Karthik on assigned a finisher's role for RCB
161.article_body: On being asked if he's been assigned a finisher's role in IPL 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "At this point of time yes, it looks like that for sure." He added, "That's what they've told me- message is very clear." Karthik, batting at number seven, scored a 7-ball 14* to help his side win against KKR by three wickets.

162.title: Maruti Suzuki celebrates 10 lakh S-CNG owners
162.article_body: Maruti Suzuki announced a new sales milestone as cumulative sales of its S-CNG vehicles crosses the 10 lakh unit mark. The company stated that it strives to provide customers with safe, dependable, technologically advanced, and environmental-friendly vehicles. Customers can now choose from the portfolio of 9 cars across multiple engine options in S-CNG.

163.title: World no. 2 Medvedev could be banned from playing Wimbledon this year
163.article_body: World number two Daniil Medvedev could be banned from playing Wimbledon this year as tournament officials are in talks with the UK government over a potential ban of Russian and Belarusian athletes. The All England Club, which hosts the Grand Slam tournament, could be allowed to ban Russian and Belarusian athletes without any legal repercussions due to its independent status.

164.title: Kuwait's govt resigns ahead of no-trust vote amid political crisis
164.article_body: The Kuwaiti government on Tuesday resigned ahead of a no-confidence vote in the Parliament against the Prime Minister. Notably, this is the country's third collective government resignation in the past year and a half. The worsening political crisis has blocked critical economic and social reforms in the Gulf country, according to The Associated Press.

165.title: Wish all your missions are successful: Sidharth on Rashmika's b'day
165.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, taking to Instagram Stories, wished actress Rashmika Mandanna on her 26th birthday. Sidharth shared a picture with Rashmika and wrote, "Happy birthday Rashmika. Wish all your missions this year are successful. Big hug and love." Sidharth and Rashmika will be seen together in 'Mission Majnu'.

166.title: It’s nice to see them play: Atletico Madrid boss Simeone on Man City
166.article_body: Atletico Madrid manager Diego Simeone on Monday said it is "a joy to watch how Manchester City play" ahead of their UEFA Champions League quarter-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. "What I like about teams like Man City is the effort they put on trying to recover the ball and maintain possession," Simeone said. "It's what all coaches want," he added.

167.title: PM took charge as protector of all Indians: Scindia on 'Operation Ganga'
167.article_body: Praising 'Operation Ganga', Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday that PM Narendra Modi had taken charge as protector of all Indians amid Ukraine crisis. "[I]...received a call at 11:30 pm [and was summoned]...to Delhi, to be sent to Romania [to oversee mission]," he added. Centre had launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate Indians from Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.

168.title: I was like 'Who Lata?': Indian composer Ricky on Mangeshkar's call after 1st Grammy win
168.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej, who won his second Grammy award, recalled, "When I won my first Grammy, I got a call from an unknown...number." "I picked up...and a 16-year-old voice tells me 'Hello I'm Lata, is this Ricky?' I'm like 'Who Lata?'," he added. Ricky further said when he realised it was Lata Mangeshkar she started laughing and he apologised.

169.title: UK adds 9 new symptoms of COVID-19 to its official list
169.article_body: Nine new symptoms of COVID-19 have emerged in the UK, two years after the pandemic started. These are: shortness of breath, tiredness, body ache and headache, sore throat, blocked or runny nose, loss of appetite, diarrhoea and feeling sick. UK had earlier recognised three symptoms of COVID-19- fever, new continuous cough and loss of sense of smell or taste.

170.title: US isn't seeking a 'divorce' from China: US trade chief
170.article_body: The US is seeking to realign its commercial ties with China in line with its policies focused on "realignment in the global economy", rather than seek a "divorce", Katherine Tai, the US Trade Representative, said. "I'd focus really on the kinds of changes that we're trying to bring, which are really not about stopping trade or trade divorce," she added.

171.title: 83 rocket launches secured for Amazon's satellite broadband network
171.article_body: Amazon has secured 83 rocket launches over five years to put together a satellite constellation called Project Kuiper to beam broadband internet, the company said on Tuesday. The launch deals were signed with Europe's Arianespace, Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance. Project Kuiper aims to use over 3,000 satellites in low earth orbit to beam high-speed internet.

172.title: US-based Triton to set up ₹10,800 cr EV manufacturing plant in Gujarat
172.article_body: Triton EV has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government to set up a ₹10,800 crore electric commercial vehicle production plant in Kutch. Initially, ₹1,200 crore will be invested by the company during FY23 for setting up the facility on a 645 acre plot in Bhuj. The unit will have annual production capacity of 50,000 trucks.

173.title: MLC who vacated seat for UP CM in 2017 expelled from BJP for 6 yrs
173.article_body: BJP expelled its sitting MLC Yashwant Singh for six years on Monday, saying that he has been campaigning for his son for Azamgarh-Mau local body authority seat against BJP's candidate. Singh, who was an SP MLC in 2017, had vacated his seat for Yogi Adityanath after he was announced as UP CM. Singh claimed he isn't campaigning for his son.

174.title: Playing IPL 2022 matches in Mumbai is not full-on advantage for MI: Rohit
