174.article_body: Five-time champions MI skipper Rohit Sharma said playing IPL 2022 matches in Mumbai's three grounds is not a full-on advantage for his side as except him and Suryakumar Yadav, there are not many players who belong to the city. "Like I said before, it's a relatively new team not many of these guys have played in...climatic conditions of...Mumbai," he stated.

175.title: Ex-cashier jailed for fraudulently exchanging demonetised notes
175.article_body: B Dinesh, former cashier at State Bank of Mysore's Periyapatna branch in Karnataka, has been jailed for seven years for fraudulently exchanging demonetised currency with legal notes worth ₹2.18 crore. Dinesh had also altered the actual denominations written on the deposit slips submitted by customers. He had exchanged notes with a gold jeweller and a pawnbroker identified as Kumar.

176.title: Elon Musk can't own over 14.9% stake in Twitter as its board member
176.article_body: Elon Musk cannot own more than 14.9% of Twitter's common stock as long as he is on the company's board of directors, according to a filing with the US' Securities and Exchange Commission. Musk, who's the world's richest person, was appointed to Twitter's board on Tuesday. He currently holds a stake of 9.2% in Twitter, making him the largest shareholder.

177.title: They threw father's photo, wore slippers on beds: Chirag on eviction
177.article_body: LJP leader Chirag Paswan has claimed that officials who came to evict him from 12, Janpath bungalow threw his father Ram Vilas Paswan's photo. "They walked on the photos with slippers on...they wore slippers all over the beds," he claimed. "This...humiliation for someone you gave the Padma Bhushan," he added. He claimed he was ready to leave by March 20.

178.title: Rapper Kanye West pulls out of Coachella music festival: Report
178.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has reportedly withdrawn from the Coachella music festival days before his performance. Kanye was scheduled to perform on April 17 and April 24. The reason behind the cancellation has not been confirmed yet. However, a source quoted by Page Six has said, "Kanye hasn't been rehearsing or putting on a production."

179.title: We are much better prepared than in the past: Ferrari boss Binotto
179.article_body: Ferrari boss Mattia Binotto said his team are "much better prepared than in the past" to compete for the Formula One world title this season. "For us to be there in the fight, that was our objective to start the season and we can be very pleased," Binotto said. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix.

180.title: Meat shops should be closed across country during Navratri: BJP MP
180.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma welcomed the South Delhi Mayor's direction for closure of meat shops during Navratri. He said the other two municipal corporations should also follow it and such shops should be closed across India during the festival. "Whether it's Muslim community or others, they should respect it which is what our culture says," Verma added.

181.title: Sri Lankan lawmakers call for formation of interim govt amid crisis
181.article_body: A group of governing party lawmakers in Sri Lanka on Tuesday called for the formation of an interim government amid a severe economic crisis. The group has warned that a failure to appoint the interim government would lead to violence and anarchy in the country. Notably, Sri Lanka's largest opposition party has said that it'll not support any interim government.

182.title: 5 killed, over 10 injured as truck collides with train in Hungary
182.article_body: Authorities on Tuesday said five people were killed and over 10 injured after a truck collided with a train in Mindszent, Hungary. Police said the train derailed from the force of the collision with the truck that was carrying seven workers. Police added five people in the truck were killed and the other two taken to hospital with serious injuries.

183.title: Rajya Sabha passes bill to unify 3 municipal corporations of Delhi
183.article_body: The Rajya Sabha on Tuesday passed the  Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, through a voice note. The bill seeks to unify three municipal corporations of Delhi. The bill was tabled in Rajya Sabha by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who claimed the AAP government in Delhi gave step-motherly treatment to north, south and east Delhi municipal corporations.

184.title: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Juno Temple are my celeb crushes: Daniel
184.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe, when asked about his top three celebrity crushes, named actresses Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Juno Temple. Talking about Juno, Daniel said, "I've worked with her, she's gorgeous and I wouldn't mind saying her name." Juno and Daniel worked together in the 2014 film 'Horns'. Daniel will next be seen in 'The Lost City'.

185.title: South Africa ends COVID-19 state of disaster, lifts restrictions
185.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Monday said the country will end its national state of disaster introduced in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic at midnight and lift most of its restrictions. "While the pandemic is not over, while the virus remains amongst us, these conditions no longer require we remain in a national state of disaster," he said.

186.title: World's most expensive NFT priced at $400 mn unveiled, buyer to get a yacht
186.article_body: Cyber Yachts, a metaverse yacht company, has unveiled the world's most expensive NFT of a megayacht priced at $400 million. The buyer of the NFT will also receive the real-world, fully-constructed megayacht, the company said. Named "Indah", the 394-foot yacht has 12 cabins, a helicopter landing pad, casino room, gym, and a foredeck hot tub with sunbeds and retractable sunshade.

187.title: Russia to resume flights with 52 'friendly' nations from April 9: PM
187.article_body: Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin on Monday said Russia will lift COVID-19 restrictions and resume flights between 52 "friendly" countries from April 9. The "friendly" countries like India, Pakistan and China mean nations that have not imposed sanctions following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has closed its airspace to 36 countries so far, including all 27 members of the European Union.

188.title: US seeks to suspend Russia from UN Human Rights Council
188.article_body: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said the US will seek to suspend Russia from the UN Human Rights Council. "We believe that the members of the Russian forces committed war crimes in Ukraine, and we believe that Russia needs to be held accountable," Thomas-Greenfield said. "Russia's participation on the Human Rights Council is a farce," she added.

189.title: 99% of world's population breathes poor quality air: WHO
189.article_body: The WHO on Monday said 99% of the world's population breathes air that is unhealthy and does not meet its standard for air quality. The findings are based on studies by over a record 6,000 cities in 117 countries that now monitor air quality. WHO said the air quality is the poorest in its Eastern Mediterranean and Southeast Asia regions.

190.title: Who are the top 10 shareholders of Twitter?
190.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is the largest shareholder of Twitter, owning a 9.2% stake in the platform. Vanguard Group is the second-largest shareholder, with an 8.4% stake, followed by Morgan Stanley Investment Management (8.1%), BlackRock (4.6%) and SSgA Funds Management (4.5%), according to FactSet. Aristotle Capital holds a 2.5% stake and Co-founder Jack Dorsey holds a 2.3% stake.

191.title: China harvesting organs from living prisoners for transplants, research claims
191.article_body: China is suspected of removing organs from living prisoners, claims a research by Australian National University's Mathew Robertson. He found it's likely some prisoners, often from marginalised political groups, are likely to have been operated on while still alive. After analysing data from transplant publications, he found in 71 reports that 'brain death couldn't have properly been declared'.

192.title: I’d go with Pochettino: Rooney backs former Spurs boss for Man Utd job
192.article_body: Former Manchester United player Wayne Rooney said he backs former Tottenham Hotspur boss Mauricio Pochettino to take over as the next Manchester United manager. "I think Pochettino has done it in the Premier League, he knows the Premier League," he said. Rooney won five Premier League titles with Manchester United who are currently seventh on the Premier League table.

193.title: Zaha scores to help Crystal Palace beat Arsenal 3-0 in PL
193.article_body: Wilfried Zaha on Monday scored to help Crystal Palace beat Arsenal 3-0 in the Premier League. Jean-Philippe Mateta and Jordan Ayew gave Palace a 2-0 lead at half-time. "I apologise to our supporters. We didn't have the presence today or the composure to dominate the situation so that is what I'm most annoyed by," Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said.

194.title: MP govt launches loan scheme to encourage self-employment
194.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan launched Mukhyamantri Udyam Kranti Yojana, a collateral-free loan scheme, on Tuesday to facilitate self-employment among youths. Under it, the state government will provide guarantee on loans of up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment with a subsidy on interest rates. "We will bring up a state-wide startup strategy," Chouhan said.

195.title: Over 600 social media accounts of govt hacked since 2017: Govt
195.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has said over 600 social media accounts of the central government were hacked since 2017. Thakur said altogether 175 accounts were hacked in 2017, 114 in 2018, 61 in 2019, 77 in 2020, 186 in 2021 and 28 so far this year. He added Indian Computer Emergency Response Team has been established to enhance cyber security.

196.title: Looking forward to working with Twitter CEO Parag: Elon Musk
196.article_body: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, who is joining Twitter's board of directors, on Tuesday tweeted, "Looking forward to working with Parag & Twitter board to make significant improvements to Twitter in coming months!" Twitter's CEO Parag Agrawal welcomed Musk to Twitter's board by saying, "He would bring great value to our Board."

197.title: Truck spills hundreds of McVitie's biscuits on road in UK, pics go viral
197.article_body: Hundreds of McVitie's biscuit boxes were split on a road after they tumbled out of the truck carrying them in the UK. While photos of the incident were widely circulated, Erewash Response on Twitter said, "Please bear with us...whilst we try and 'digest' this issue." A Twitter user wrote, "On my way with a bucket load of tea."

198.title: US dollar reaches over 300 against Sri Lankan rupee for the 1st time
198.article_body: Sri Lanka's local banks said that the US dollar reached over 300 against the Sri Lankan rupee (LKR) for the first time as the nation is facing an economic crisis. Sri Lanka is facing one of its worst economic crises in recent decades with shortage of foreign exchange, which has led to a shortage of fuel and long power cuts.

199.title: EU bans Russian coal imports worth €4 bn per yr in 5th sanctions package amid war
199.article_body: The European Union on Tuesday said it would ban the import of coal from Russia that's worth €4 billion per year, in its fifth sanctions package over the Ukraine war. It also imposed a full transaction ban on four key Russian banks, including Russia's second-largest bank VTB. Russian and Russia-operated vessels have also been banned from accessing EU ports.

200.title: Poland to buy 250 Abrams tanks from US amid conflict in Ukraine
200.article_body: Poland has signed a deal with the US to buy 250 Abrams tanks as it seeks to bolster its defence amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The sale of tanks to Poland is another sign of a deep and growing defence relationship with the US, according to Reuters. The US has deployed additional troops in Poland in response to the invasion.

201.title: Will impose sanctions on 9 Russian, 9 Belarusian individuals: Canada
201.article_body: Canada on Monday said it will impose sanctions on nine Russian and nine Belarusian individuals that are close associates of the Russian and Belarusian regimes following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "By enabling Vladimir Putin's senseless invasion of Ukraine, these close collaborators of the regime are complicit in the horrific events unfolding before our eyes," Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said.

202.title: Court denies bail to 8 men arrested for attack on Delhi CM's house
202.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday dismissed the bail plea of eight persons who were arrested for an attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence last week. The court said such protesters had no regard even for court directions which were communicated to them that no protest is allowed at the Chief Minister's house.

203.title: Pic from space shows dead bodies lying on a street in Ukraine
203.article_body: A satellite picture showed dead bodies lying on Yablonska Street in Ukraine's Bucha after Russian invasion. Ukraine accused Russian forces on Sunday of carrying out a "massacre" in the town, one of the towns recaptured by Ukrainian troops as Russia regrouped for battles in eastern Ukraine. Russia denied the allegations, calling them a "provocation" by Ukraine.

204.title: RCB to bowl first against unbeaten RR in their IPL 2022 clash, both teams unchanged
204.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against unbeaten Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are unchanged. RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell will be eligible to play in IPL 2022 from next match due to Cricket Australia's rules.

205.title: There's slight issue in death bowling of RR: Aakash ahead of RR vs RCB
205.article_body: Ahead of RR-RCB match in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said there is a "slight issue" in death bowling of current table-toppers RR. "Prasidh Krishna is not your gun death bowler. Trent Boult is a good death bowler, but again, not your gun death pacer," he added. The match will be played today at Wankhede Stadium.

206.title: AIADMK workers protest against property tax hike by Tamil Nadu govt
206.article_body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) workers, including party coordinator O Panneerselvam on Tuesday, protested in Chennai against the hike in property tax announced by the Tamil Nadu government. The protestors demanded that the DMK-led state government roll back the tax increase. Notably, the state government on Sunday proposed a hike of up to 150% in the property tax.

207.title: CM Kejriwal says Delhi's sports policy is built on 3 pillars
207.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, while felicitating Indian Olympians in recognition of their achievements in the Tokyo Olympics, said that Delhi's sports policy is based on three pillars. The first pillar is to establish a sports culture, the second is to identify children with potential and the third is to give financial help to those who brought accolades, Kejriwal said.

208.title: Fire engine damaged after getting caught in manhole fire in Gujarat
208.article_body: A fire engine's door was damaged after it got caught in a fire that broke out from a sewage line and spilled onto the roads from a manhole mouth on the BPC road of Gujarat's Vadodara on Tuesday. "When we started fighting...fire from...first manhole, positive pressure was created on...second cover, which...caused a minor blast and damaged...[the] tender," an official said.

209.title: 29-year-old woman raped inside her house in Gurugram
209.article_body: A 29-year-old woman in Gurugram was allegedly raped inside her house by a man who lives in the same locality on Monday, police said. The accused, who is absconding, had allegedly come to her house to enquire about her husband and then forced himself upon her. The victim later narrated the ordeal to her husband, following which they approached police.

210.title: Delhi Jal Board scraps order allowing 2-hr leave to Muslims during Ramzan
210.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board on Tuesday withdrew its earlier order of giving a short leave, approximately two hours a day, to Muslim employees during the month of Ramzan. The earlier order said they can take leaves till May 2, 2022, or till the date Eid-ul-Fitr is declared. They were asked to complete tasks during the remaining office hours.

211.title: Pune businessman killed after neighbour attacks him with axe
211.article_body: A 34-year-old dairy businessman died after his neighbour allegedly attacked him with an axe in front of his house in Pune on Sunday. According to police, the 35-year-old accused, Ganesh Kharat, had borrowed ₹20,000 from the victim a few days ago and the two had been fighting over the money. Kharat was arrested after the victim's father filed an FIR.

212.title: I'm really happy Elon is joining the Twitter board: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
212.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey on Tuesday tweeted, "I'm really happy Elon Musk is joining the Twitter board!" Dorsey added, " He cares deeply about our world and Twitter's role in it. Parag Agrawal (Twitter's CEO) and Elon both lead with their hearts, and they will be an incredible team." Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder with a 9.2% stake.

213.title: I did what is right for company: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer on Grover's exit
213.article_body: Speaking about Ashneer Grover’s exit, BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer said he did what was right for the company. While mentioning that he and Grover were friends, he said, "We were like very very close…But my job here isn't to be a great friend. My job is to do what's right." Sameer added, "I won't let anything come on my reputation."

214.title: Moldova needs international support to cope with Ukraine crisis: PM
214.article_body: Moldova PM Natalia Gavrilita said on Tuesday that the country requires international support to cope with the influx of refugees from neighbouring Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion. Gavrilita added that Moldova, which is hosting about 1 lakh Ukrainian refugees, requires financial assistance. Germany has said it will aid Moldova in reducing its economic and financial dependence on Russia.

215.title: 3 arrested in Tripura over alleged links with Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen
215.article_body: A joint team of Tripura police and central intelligence officials arrested three persons for their alleged links with Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB), police said on Tuesday. The suspects were arrested from the Khayokhola area in Sepahijala district on Sunday. Charges against them include waging and attempting to wage war against the Indian government, among others, an official said.

216.title: Not at all: LSG's Krunal Pandya on whether he is missing Hardik Pandya
216.article_body: On being asked whether he is missing his brother, GT captain Hardik Pandya, after having played together for Mumbai Indians, LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya said, "Not at all." "I genuinely feel like this is my first season of IPL," he said. "I had a great run with Mumbai Indians as well, I had some great memories over there," he added.

217.title: Might have to call Ronaldo as CR7 is at risk now: New world no. 7 Ruud
217.article_body: Norwegian Casper Ruud, who rose to world number seven, said he might have to call Cristiano Ronaldo as "CR7 is at risk" now. "Don't know if we've to do some negotiations and see who can actually have this number," he joked. Ruud has same initials as Ronaldo, who was nicknamed "CR7" after sporting the number seven jersey for Manchester United.

218.title: Delhi Police arrests 106, recover 1081 gms of heroin in last 24 hrs
218.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 106 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 1081 grams of heroin in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 13 proclaimed offenders, seized 742 litres of illicit liquor and recovered eight stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,867 calls, the post added.

219.title: 'Give probability of getting fair-skinned bride', says math problem; netizens react
219.article_body: A sample mathematics problem reportedly for ISC students asked them to calculate probability of a man finding a bride with three "qualities"- white complexion, handsome dowry and manners and style. A picture of the same was shared on Twitter and Reddit. "Can't believe this is real," said one user, while another said, "This is so stupid, it made me laugh."

220.title: Malvika enters 2nd round, Prannoy loses at Korea Open 2022
220.article_body: Indian shuttler HS Prannoy lost in first round of men's singles event at 2022 Korea Open Super 500 badminton tournament on Tuesday. The world number 23 lost to 71st-ranked Cheam June Wei of Malaysia 17-21, 7-21 in 41 minutes. Earlier, unseeded Indian Malvika Bansod entered second round of women's singles after defeating world number 24 Han Yue 20-22, 22-20, 21-10.

221.title: Diesel leaks from pipeline during theft & causes fire on Thane road
221.article_body: Diesel leaked from a pipeline when a few people allegedly tried to steal it on Tuesday morning in Thane. The leak caused a fire on the Shil-Mahape road but no casualties were reported. The accused allegedly stole diesel from a pipeline of BPCL passing from Mumbai refinery to Delhi, said an official from Thane Municipal Corporation.

222.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused isn't mentally unstable: Doctors
222.article_body: JSP Singh, Superintendent-in-Chief of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose District Hospital, has claimed that Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple, isn't mentally unstable. "The accused...was talking coherently, was responding to the queries of doctors and the police and didn't display...violent behaviour," he added. His father had said he suffers from depression.

223.title: Elon Musk to join Twitter's board of directors
223.article_body: Twitter is appointing the world's richest person Elon Musk to its board of directors after he disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in the company. "He's both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on Twitter, and in the boardroom," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

224.title: EVs in Delhi can be charged for free in the noon at 35 spots from June 1
224.article_body: EV owners in Delhi will be able to charge their vehicles for free between 12:00 pm and 3:00 pm from June 1 onwards, ElectriVa Founder Sumit Dhanuka said. The facility will be provided to commercial and non-commercial EVs at around 35 charging stations operational along the Ring Road. "We want to bolster Delhi's EV ecosystem," Dhanuka added.

225.title: Model from Brazil faces divorce from 1 of his 9 wives, says 'I wish to have 10 wives'
225.article_body: Arthur O Urso, a male model from Brazil who went viral after his marriage to nine different women is now facing divorce from one of his wives. He said she wants a divorce because she was "missing a monogamous relationship". However, he added that he plans to marry more women as "his wish has always been to have 10 wives".

226.title: Says a lot about toxic masculinity: Schumer on Will slapping Chris
226.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said actor Will Smith slapping presenter Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 was "really upsetting". "It was just a f***ing bummer...I think it says so much about toxic masculinity," Schumer stated. Schumer, along with Regina Hall and Wanda Sykes, hosted the 94th Academy Awards. It was for the first time that three women hosted the Oscars.

227.title: Russian forces regrouping & preparing offensive in southeast: Ukraine
227.article_body: Russian forces are regrouping and preparing for an offensive in Ukraine's southeast, the Ukrainian military said. The military also said Russian forces aim "to establish full control over" two breakaway regions of Ukraine, which Russia has recognised as independent republics. Russian forces have retreated from northern Ukraine after Russia announced it would shift its focus from Kyiv.

228.title: US crypto billionaire-led FTX may invest in India's MPL: Report
228.article_body: US crypto billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried-led exchange FTX is in talks to invest in Bengaluru-based esports and mobile gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL), TechCrunch reported. MPL is looking to get the investment as an extension to its Series E funding at a valuation of $2.5 billion. Last year, MPL turned a unicorn with a $2.3 billion valuation.

229.title: 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese: Report
229.article_body: As many as 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese, as per a compendium by the Council for Social Development for 2019-20. Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district had the lowest percentage of women who were overweight or obese in the state in 2019-2020. The compendium has a comprehensive statistical picture of health and demographic status in Telangana.

230.title: Was easier to act with father than to have him as director: Shahid
230.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about working with father Pankaj Kapur in the film 'Jersey', said, "It was easier to act with him than to have him as a director." "It was much more relaxed. We used to get time to chill...have a cup of coffee together in between shots," Shahid added. Pankaj had directed Shahid in the 2011 film 'Mausam'.

231.title: Don't spit, disturb others: Pune Metro in etiquette manual for passengers
231.article_body: The Pune Metro has released a pamphlet named 'Metro Etiquettes' which has various directions for the passengers. "Spitting is a crime! It not only makes the place dirty but also can spread contagious diseases," the metro says in the pamphlet. It also asks passengers to keep the metro clean and not disturb other commuters with phone calls and music players.

232.title: Pune law student seeking education loan online cheated of ₹90,000
232.article_body: A 20-year-old Pune law student, seeking an education loan online, was cheated of ₹90,000, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters after calling on a number posted on a website. She was then asked to make multiple transfers in order to obtain a ₹5 lakh loan. A case has been registered under the IT Act, police added.

233.title: Ex-TCS staff turns part-time Zomato delivery agent, shares post on his challenges
233.article_body: A former TCS employee, Srinivasan Jayaraman's post on challenges he faced as a part-time Zomato delivery agent is being widely circulated. Jayaraman wrote about the inaccuracy of delivery locations of customers and restaurants. He said often phone numbers aren't properly updated and there were cases of long-distance delivery locations. "I salute those who choose this as a career," he said.

234.title: MP police team takes dip in Ganga with handcuffed man, served show-cause notice
234.article_body: A police team from Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur that had travelled to Uttar Pradesh to arrest a man allegedly took a holy dip in the river Ganga with the handcuffed accused. The officers were served a show-cause notice for dereliction of duty, an officer said. The team should have returned directly to the police station after arresting the accused, he added.

235.title: Govt employees asked to use bicycles for office on Wednesdays in Lakshadweep
235.article_body: The Lakshadweep administration has announced that it'll observe 'Cycle Day' every Wednesday from April 6 and all government employees will have to come to the office on bicycles to beat pollution. Employees with disability or any medical condition will be exempted from this rule, an official order said. Government officials have been asked to not use motor vehicles on Wednesdays.

236.title: Gurugram's max temp to touch 45°C by Sat; IMD issues heatwave alert
236.article_body: IMD has issued a yellow heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram and Faridabad, till April 7. Further, in its weekly forecast, IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 45°C by April 9. Gurugram on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 42.3°C, the highest maximum temperature recorded in the city so far this year.

237.title: Ignore, he needs to run his house too: Anupam on Ashish's 'Shark Tank' spoof
237.article_body: Shaadi.com's Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal responded to a fan who said they felt "very bad" about the way Mittal was portrayed in popular YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani's spoof of the show, titled 'Sasta Shaark Tank'. In an Instagram comment, Mittal wrote, "Ignore, use bhi apna ghar chalana hai (Ashish has to run his house too)."

238.title: Over 25,000 foreigners overstayed in India in 2021: Nityanand Rai
238.article_body: As many as 25,143 foreigners overstayed in the country after their visas expired in 2021, Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai told Parliament on Tuesday. "The overall number of overstaying foreigners from the period prior to 2019 and up to 31st December 2021 is 3,93,431," Rai said in a written reply.

239.title: After 'Kurup' & 'FIR', Vijay's 'Beast' gets banned in Kuwait: Report
239.article_body: Actor Vijay's film 'Beast' has reportedly been banned by the Ministry of Information in Kuwait. "Reason could be portrayal of Pakistan, terrorists or violence," film trade analyst Ramesh Bala tweeted. Recently, Dulquer Salmaan's 'Kurup' and Vishnu Vishal's 'FIR' were banned in Kuwait. "Kuwait [censorship] is becoming very strict in GCC compared to other countries in the region," Ramesh added.

240.title: US punishing 'disobedient' Imran Khan over Moscow visit: Russia
240.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Pakistan, the Russian Foreign Ministry issued a statement, accusing the US of intervening in the country's internal affairs. It said that the US decided to punish "disobedient" Imran Khan over his visit to Moscow. Khan met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on February 24, the day when Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine.

241.title: Krushna trolls Archana for not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show's US tour
241.article_body: Archana Puran Singh shared a video with comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek, where he teases her for not joining 'The Kapil Sharma' team on their US tour. "Archana ji ko nahi le ke jaa rahe." (We aren't taking Archana ji). Reacting to it, Archana jokingly said they aren't taking her to save money. She captioned the video, "Behind the scenes masti (fun)."

242.title: Denmark expels 15 Russian diplomats over security concerns
242.article_body: Denmark on Tuesday expelled 15 Russian 'intelligence officers' it said were serving as diplomats. "We will not accept...Russian intelligence officers...spying on Danish soil," Danish Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod said. Notably, the move comes amid reports of atrocities by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha, following which, Italy, Germany and France announced expulsion of several Russian diplomats.

243.title: Making coffee easier than bowling in powerplay in India: RCB's Willey
243.article_body: Asked to choose between making coffee and bowling in the powerplay in India, RCB all-rounder David Willey said the former is easier. Willey, who was bought by the Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹2 crore, registered bowling figures of 3-0-28-0 and 2-0-7-0 in his side's two matches so far in IPL 2022. RCB will face RR today at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

244.title: European Commission Prez to visit Kyiv this week to meet Zelenskyy
244.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will travel to Kyiv this week for a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, an European Union (EU) spokesman tweeted on Tuesday. She will be accompanied by EU's top diplomat Josep Borrell on the trip. European Parliament President Roberta Metsola had visited Kyiv last week.

245.title: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
245.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.

246.title: Will hold such events across Maha: Aaditya at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave
246.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray, while speaking at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave, on Tuesday said more such events will be held across the state. "The green industry is going to take a huge jump and we can lead the world in that. Creating revenue for our country and jobs for people," Thackeray said at the conclave.

247.title: TN Cong leader, who said Rahul & Priyanka should step aside, sacked
247.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress spokesperson Americai V Narayanan, who said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi should step aside to save Congress, has been sacked, reports said on Tuesday. "I love Rahul Gandhi but unfortunately, he has not delivered," he said. He also urged Congress to bring back former leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Jagan Mohan Reddy, Sharad Pawar and K Chandrashekar Rao.

248.title: RRR writer Vijayendra says film will have possible sequel: Sreenivasa
248.article_body: Telugu film producer Sreenivasa Kumar, who attended the success party of 'RRR', took to Twitter and said the 'RRR' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has hinted at the film's sequel. "'RRR' will be a franchise and possible sequel says writer Vijayendra," Sreenivasa tweeted. The success party, attended by Jr NTR and Ram Charan, was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish.

249.title: Rohit has been a fun captain in IPL: MI all-rounder Tim David
249.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, MI all-rounder Tim David said he's been a fun captain in IPL 2022. "I've only played two games with him, so just getting used to playing with him. Getting used to playing with lots of guys in the team, but we'll find our feet," he added. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

250.title: 2 men steal 15 Llyod ACs from Ahmedabad godown, arrested
250.article_body: Two men have been arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) for stealing 15 air conditioners from a factory godown in Naroda. Police said that the accused Sabyasachi Pal and Mehul More, both 20-years-old, were arrested with a rickshaw that had the air conditioners that they had stolen in November last year.

251.title: MP CM launches scheme to give loans up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment
251.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday launched the 'Udyam Kranti Yojana' in order to facilitate self-employment for the youth. Under the scheme, a loan guarantee of ₹1 lakh to ₹50 lakh will be provided with subsidies on interest rate for self-employment. Around one lakh youth are expected to benefit from the scheme in the financial year 2022-23.

252.title: Fuel price hike in India is 1/10th of price hike in other countries: HS Puri
252.article_body: Fuel prices hike in India is one-tenth of the price hike in other countries, Petroleum Minister HS Puri said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Comparing gasoline (petrol) prices between April 2021 and March 22, the prices in the US have increased by 51%, Canada 52%, Germany 55%, UK 55%, France 50%, Spain 58% but in India 5%," said Puri.

253.title: 2 held for threatening gay man with his sex video in Coimbatore
253.article_body: Two private college students were arrested for allegedly extorting money from a man by making him involved in a homosexual act and recording it in Coimbatore. According to the police, the accused, aged 19 and 22, had snatched a mobile phone and cash from the complainant. They also threatened to circulate the sex video if the complainant approached the police.

254.title: Wasn't allowed to put lipstick, thought life will be set on becoming actor: Rupali
254.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that her mother was strict and did not allow the actress to wear lipstick. She added that wearing lipstick was a big deal for her and she thought her life would be set if she became an actor. She added that she thought the director and other crew members worked hard and actors have it easy.

255.title: Bharti documents her baby's birth journey, fan says 'You're a strong woman'
255.article_body: Comedienne-host Bharti Singh and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, who welcomed their son on Sunday, shared a video on their YouTube channel LOL (Life of Limbachiyaa's). In the video, Bharti documented her baby's entire birth journey starting from when they went to the doctor to the last day of Bharti's pregnancy. Reacting to it, a user commented, "You're a strong woman."

256.title: Shot for a difficult climax right after my cancer treatment: Sanjay on KGF 2
256.article_body: Ahead of the release of 'KGF 2', actor Sanjay Dutt spoke about the "difficult climax" he shot right after his cancer treatment. "The climax had to be mounted on a large scale. It was a difficult climax, there was mud, dust, fire and a lot of action," Sanjay said. He added that the makers did everything to make him comfortable.

257.title: India has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population at present: Govt
257.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said India, at present, has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population with 33.41 lakh registered nursing personnel. He added that the country's doctor-population ratio is 1:834 with 13.01 lakh allopathic doctors and 5.65 lakh AYUSH doctors. Undergraduate seats in medical colleges have increased from 51,348 before 2014 to 89,875 in 2022, he added.

258.title: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles arrive at 2 major nesting sites in Odisha
258.article_body: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles have arrived at two major mass nesting sites in Odisha this year. According to officials, a record of over 5.5 lakh turtles congregated at Rushikulya estuary, whereas around five lakh turtles arrived at Gahirmatha Marine Sanctuary in Kendrapara. "We can't say why more turtles preferred Rushikulya rookery. It's a natural phenomenon," an official said.

259.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 makes up 72% of COVID cases in US: CDC
259.article_body: Omicron BA.2 sub-variant now makes up 72.2% of the COVID cases in the US, up from nearly 57.3% in the past week, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. However, the overall COVID-19 infections in America have dropped sharply after hitting record levels in January. According to WHO, BA.2 now makes up about 86% of all cases globally.

260.title: Delhi govt's step-motherly behaviour hinders working of 3 MCDs: Shah
260.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that the Delhi government's "step-motherly behaviour" hinders the efficient working of all three municipal corporations. "If state governments behave in a step-motherly fashion with civic bodies, neither Panchayati Raj nor urban local bodies will be successful," Shah added. He was speaking in Rajya Sabha on the Bill to merge the civic bodies.

261.title: Kashmir Files crosses ₹300 cr at worldwide box office, director shares post
261.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has earned ₹331 crore at the worldwide box office. He took to Twitter on Monday to share the news and wrote, "Thanks to all Indians all over the world in helping #TheKashmirFiles tell the truth to the world." It stars Mithun Chakraborty, Pallavi Joshi and Anupam Kher among others in pivotal roles.

262.title: Nobody pushing Pant to get ton in ODIs; 40s, 50s are fine: Rathour
262.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour said nobody is pushing Rishabh Pant to get a century in ODIs, terming it as fine if he can consistently score 40s, 50s. "Nobody wants him not to play his shots, we just want him to be more selective in picking the bowlers," added Rathour. Pant is yet to score his maiden ODI ton.

263.title: Hope Williamson will play in the England Test series: NZ coach Gary Stead
263.article_body: New Zealand coach Gary Stead said he is hopeful of captain Kane Williamson featuring in the Test series against England in June but emphasises being "smart" while managing his workload. "He's (Williamson) dying to play cricket for New Zealand...but we can't burn him out...We have to be smart around those things," Stead said while referring to Williamson's recent elbow injury.

264.title: Hybrid security to be evolved at establishments where CISF is deployed: Govt
264.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that hybrid models of security will be evolved to provide security at establishments where the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is deployed. "There is no proposal under consideration to train and certify private security agencies across the country by CISF," MoS for Home Nityanand Rai said.

265.title: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
265.article_body: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.

266.title: After SRK & Sanjay, Notebook actor Zaheer Iqbal receives UAE's Golden Visa
266.article_body: Zaheer Iqbal, who was seen in Salman Khan-backed film 'Notebook', took to Instagram to announce that he has received the UAE's Golden Visa. The visa will stay valid for 10 years and will allow him to work and live in the country without a national sponsor. Actors who've been granted Golden Visa include Shah Rukh Khan, Sanjay Dutt and Mammootty.

267.title: I have seen bodies frozen due to being burned: Ram Charan on Russia-Ukraine war
267.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said he has seen bodies frozen due to being burned in videos sent by Rusty, who was his security-in-charge while shooting for 'RRR' in Ukraine. "The videos were dreadful. If you touch [the bodies] probably they will turn into ashes," added Ram. "Rusty burst out crying," stated Ram. "I keep texting him...to pep him up," said Ram.

268.title: Indian pair of Manika, Archana enter top 5 in TT world rankings
268.article_body: India's women's doubles pair of Manika Batra and Archana Girish Kamath have moved up to the fourth spot (women's doubles category) in the latest world rankings issued by the International Table Tennis Federation. The two places' jump in the world rankings is due to the duo's performance in the WTT Star Contender Doha 2022 where they won a bronze medal.

269.title: 99% of world’s population now breathes polluted air: WHO
269.article_body: Almost the entire global population is breathing polluted air, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Monday. The WHO data revealed that 99% of people in the world are inhaling unhealthy levels of fine particulate matter and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) that threaten their health. People living in low and middle-income countries have been suffering the highest exposures, the data stated.

270.title: Videos of Zakir Naik found in laptop of Gorakhnath temple attacker: Police
270.article_body: The UP Police's Anti-Terrorism Squad found videos of radical Muslim preacher Zakir Naik and violence in Syria in the laptop recovered from the 29-year-old man who attacked two policemen outside Gorakhnath temple on Sunday. The attack is a part of a "serious conspiracy" and could be termed a "terror incident" based on evidence collected so far, the police added.

271.title: Rachakonda Police seizes 46,500 litres of illegal diesel, arrests 6
271.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police shared that an illegal diesel mafia has been busted in the city. The post further said that police has arrested six persons and seized 46,500 litres of illegal diesel from their possession. Notably, the price of petrol has reached ₹118.59 per litre in Hyderabad, while that of diesel has reached ₹104.62 per litre.

272.title: Once wanted to make Rohit bhai happy, he abused me on the field: Ishan Kishan
272.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan revealed he once wanted to make captain Rohit Sharma happy by trying to make the ball old by rolling it on ground during a match in his first IPL season. "I rolled it...but there was dew...He took out his towel and abused me," Ishan said. "He later said, 'Don't take it personally...it's just match-to-match'," he added.

273.title: Won't get scared even if I'm shot: Raut as ED attaches his properties
273.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said he won't get scared even if he is shot or sent to jail. His reaction came after ED attached properties linked to him in connection to an alleged ₹1,034 land scam case. He claimed he doesn't even own one acre of land in Alibaug and purchased properties with his hard-earned money.

274.title: Becoming someone on whom one can rely: KL Rahul on Deepak Hooda
274.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul has said that Deepak Hooda is "becoming" a reliable middle-order batter after the latter scored 51 runs off 33 balls against the Sunrisers Hyderabad on Monday. "I've been playing with Hooda for the last 3-4 seasons...He had to wait for his chance...and now is becoming someone you can rely on," Rahul said.

275.title: Airbnb clarifies it's not suspending Russians from making reservations
275.article_body: Airbnb has clarified that it's not banning Russian and Belarusian nationals from making reservations on its platform. Earlier, the platform had said guests located in Russia or Belarus will not be able to make new reservations on Airbnb. Some users interpreted the statement, which was made in Russian, to mean the policy applied to all Russian and Belarusian nationals globally.

276.title: Fish can perform addition and subtraction, finds study
276.article_body: Cichlid and stingray fish species can perform simple calculations in numbers ranging from one to five, a study stated. Researchers trained them to perform simple additions and subtractions by increasing or decreasing an initial value by one. They can also be trained to detect smaller quantities without counting. It's, however, not known what these fish need their mathematical abilities for.

277.title: Mesmerising sight: Aaditya Thackeray on Pune college's boat show
277.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray said the 94th Regatta (boat show) organised by the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) was "a mesmerising sight". "It's a fantastic event with a mix of sports and grace," Thackeray said. "Wow, so nice to see a regatta after so many years. Once upon a time, I was also a participant," a Twitter user commented.

278.title: Undermines women empowerment: NCW on textbook listing merits of dowry
278.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has written to Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan seeking remedial action against the sociology textbook for nurses which listed merits of dowry. Calling dowry a social evil in India, NCW said portraying it in a positive way would undermine women empowerment. "It sends very wrong message to...students about prevailing menace of dowry," the NCW said.

279.title: My father went to hospital to get his BP checked: Ishan Kishan on IPL 2018 auction
279.article_body: Recalling IPL 2018 auction wherein he was bought by MI for ₹6.2 crore, Ishan Kishan said when he went home after receiving the news, his father wasn't there. "I asked my mother, 'Where is dad?' She said, 'He has gone to hospital to get his BP checked'," Ishan said. "I was thinking 'What has happened to my family?'" Ishan added.

280.title: US author who wrote 'How to murder your husband' essay accused of killing husband
280.article_body: A 71-year-old US-based romance novelist is accused of fatally shooting her husband in June 2018 to get more than $1.5 million in life insurance. Nancy Crampton-Brophy had written an essay entitled 'How to murder your husband' in 2011. "The thing I know about murder is that everyone...has it in him/her (to murder) when pushed far enough," the essay reportedly said.

281.title: Elephants can dance as well: HDFC Bank's CEO on merger with HDFC
281.article_body: HDFC Bank's CEO Sashidhar Jagdishan, who will lead the merged entity of HDFC Bank and HDFC, said, "Elephants can dance as well." When asked about the next milestone, Jagdishan said, "We don't work for any milestones." He added, "Even if I'm not there...this engine created by the founding fathers...it's such a fantastic platform that it will grow on its own."

282.title: Yami shares jail inmate's story who prepared career options for his daughter
282.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, who'll be seen as a cop in 'Dasvi', shared the story of a jail inmate that stayed with her. She said, "One inmate...sent his register...for an autograph and with a picture of his daughter." Yami added that he prepared different career options in the register for his daughter including that of an IAS officer and a banker.

283.title: Had released 'Aankhen' with 2 different endings in India & abroad: Director
283.article_body: Vipul Shah's directorial 'Aankhen', which featured Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar and Sushmita Sen, has completed 20 years of its release today.  Vipul revealed that they had released the film with "two different endings in India and abroad". "Overseas print had an open-end...I was told, India isn't ready for such open-ended stories as...concept of sequel didn't exist back then," he added.

284.title: Maxwell won't play vs RR due to Cricket Australia's clause: RCB coach Hesson
284.article_body: RCB head coach Mike Hesson has said Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell won't be available for their match against RR on Tuesday and will only be available from their next game onwards. Hesson explained that while Maxwell has joined the camp, he can't play before Australia complete their tour of Pakistan. Australia will play their last T20I against Pakistan on Tuesday.

285.title: Blessed it happened when young as I can recover: Hooda on Krunal spat
285.article_body: Discussing his spat with Krunal Pandya while playing for Baroda in 2021, Deepak Hooda said, "I am blessed that it all happened at a young age because then you can recover as well [as] learn a lot." Both Hooda and Krunal are representing LSG in IPL 2022. They were seen hugging each other in LSG's IPL 2022 opener against GT.

286.title: Italy expels 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns
286.article_body: Italy reportedly expelled 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. "The measure is in agreement with other European and Atlantic partners and is necessary for reasons linked to our national security," said the country's Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio. The Italian government reportedly summoned the Russian ambassador to inform him about the expulsion.

287.title: ByteDance scraped content from Instagram, Snapchat for older app: Report
287.article_body: TikTok-parent ByteDance made fake accounts with content scraped from Instagram, Snapchat and other such platforms and used them on Flipagram, a TikTok predecessor, in 2017, BuzzFeed News reported citing four former employees of the company. The scraping was seen as a "growth hack" for the company. ByteDance's goal was to scrape more than 10,000 videos a day, a source said.

288.title: 13-yr-old girl writes poems on death, dies by suicide in Maha
288.article_body: A 13-year-old girl died by suicide at her residence in Maharashtra's Nagpur after writing poems and quotes on death, police said on Tuesday. Police found a notebook in her bedroom, in which she had been writing poems on death in Marathi and English for the last two months. The incident occurred at 1 pm on Monday, reports said.

289.title: Hungary PM must choose between Russia & other world: Zelenskyy
289.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Hungarian PM Viktor Orban will have to choose between Moscow and the "other world" following his election victory on Sunday. Zelenskyy accused Orban of fearing Russian influence. Orban has for years maintained close ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The Russian leader had also congratulated Orban after his party won a fourth term in office.

290.title: 4 arrested in UP for posing as magistrates and trying to see question papers
290.article_body: The Agra Police arrested four people who entered a school posing as magistrates and sought to inspect a secure room where question papers of UP Board examinations were kept, an official said. "They asked police and centre manager to take them to strong room...When asked, they were not able to prove their identity and provide authorisation letter," the police informed.

291.title: Germany warns its Russian speakers of disinformation on Ukraine war
291.article_body: Germany has warned Russian speakers in the country against Kremlin's 'disinformation' amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Russian speakers in Germany should "inform themselves comprehensively with national and international media", German government official Wolfgang Büchner said. His remarks came after Kremlin alleged that the killing of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha had been staged.

292.title: Woman recovers from vertebra fracture after neurosurgery in Hyd
292.article_body: The doctors at Hyderabad's Century Hospital successfully performed minimal invasive neurosurgery to help a 60-year-old woman recover from a fracture in the lower vertebra. She was reportedly suffering from severe back pain after a fall incident. The doctors performed a vertebroplasty procedure on her, under which bone cement is injected into the backbones (vertebrae) that have cracked or broken.

293.title: Bird population in tropical forests drops by 90% in 40 years: Study
293.article_body: According to research, the number of birds living in tropical forests declined by up to 90% in the last 40 years. Researchers recorded a decline in the number of 40 species amounting to 70% of the total bird population. Moreover, 35 species declined to at least half of their initial numbers. Only the hummingbird and puffbird populations saw a rise.

294.title: Indian composer Ricky Kej touches co-winner's feet at Grammys, Raveena praises him
294.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej won his second Grammy when he and collaborator Stewart Copeland won Best New Age Album at 64th Annual Grammy Awards. Actress Raveena Tandon shared a video where Ricky is seen touching Stewart's feet on stage. "So so proud. Brings the divinity of our culture on an international stage...Pays respect to his guru. #proudtobeindian," she wrote.

295.title: Nagaland's 1st woman Rajya Sabha MP takes oath in traditional attire, jewellery
295.article_body: S Phangnon Konyak, the President of BJP Nagaland Mahila Morcha, took oath in the Rajya Sabha wearing her traditional Naga clothes and jewellery on Monday. She is the first woman from the state to get a berth in Parliament's Upper House. The 44-year-old leader was elected unopposed as the Rajya Sabha member from Nagaland on March 31.

296.title: Water cannons used on AAP water tariff hike protesters in Chandigarh
296.article_body: The police on Tuesday used water cannons to disperse a protest against the increase in water tariff in Chandigarh by AAP workers. The party tweeted a video of the incident and accused the BJP of making things costlier after "fraudulently" getting a Mayor of the BJP party. The protesters had been moving towards the Union Territory's Municipal Corporation office.

297.title: All practices in compliance with law: Zomato after CCI orders probe
297.article_body: Zomato issued a statement after the Competition Commission of India ordered an investigation into the conduct of Swiggy and Zomato. It said while CCI has prima facie didn't find concerns with respect to their independence on levy of commissions or alleged bundling of services, it'll work to assist them and explain why their services are in compliance with the law.

298.title: 10,600 km road network ready in Naxal-hit areas: Nityanand Rai
298.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said 10, 600 kilometres of roads have been constructed in Left Wing Extremism (LWE) or Naxal-affected areas at an expenditure of around ₹13,000 crore. Over 16,200 kilometres of roads have been approved in such areas, he added. "The number of districts reporting violence...reduced...from 96% in 2010 to 46% in 2021," Rai added.

299.title: Tamil Nadu man builds ₹80,000 statue of his dog who died last year
299.article_body: An 82-year-old retired government employee has built a statue in the memory of his dog named Tom who died in 2021 in the Sivaganga district of Tamil Nadu. The man has spent ₹80,000 on the statue. "Tom was with me since 2010 but he died in 2021," the man said, adding that they offer food to the statue.

300.title: Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh is unconstitutional: Cong’s Deepender Hooda
300.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda termed Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh as "unconstitutional". "The resolution of Punjab over Chandigarh is in violation of the Act under which Punjab, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh were formed in the year 1966," Hooda said. "Punjab has suppressed the water of Haryana’s share, even after the Supreme Court’s decision in favour of Haryana," Hooda stated.

301.title: 3 booked for abetting suicide of 23-yr-old man in Gurugram
301.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) on Monday said that three men have been booked for abetting the suicide of a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The man had jumped in front of a train on April 2, according to the police. The victim's family has claimed that he killed himself after being forced into peddling drugs by the accused.

302.title: Bombay HC asks Ola, Uber to comply with Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines
302.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the cab aggregators, including Uber India and Ola, to comply with the conditions laid down in the Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines (MVAG) 2020. The court's directions were given to those firms that have been granted provisional licenses. The bench said that the MVAG-2020 will be applicable until the Maharashtra Regulation of Aggregator Rules-2021 is approved.

303.title: Even Sachin took time to score his first ODI ton: Kiran More on Pant
303.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who is yet to score his maiden century in ODIs, ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More said even Sachin Tendulkar took time to score his maiden ODI hundred. "There will be times when you smash your head and say, 'Why did Pant play that shot?', but...we need to be ready to accept that," Rohit Sharma had recently said.

304.title: NTR30 is loaded with drama, will live up post RRR expectations: Jr NTR
304.article_body: Jr NTR, talking about his upcoming film with director Koratala Siva, said, "It's going to be loaded with drama because...drama sells a lot." Jr NTR's film with Koratala is tentatively named 'NTR30'. He added 'NTR30' will have everything that the audience expects after the release of 'RRR'. Speaking about 'NTR31' with director Prashanth Neel, he called it a wonderful project.

305.title: Figuring out how MS Dhoni's mind works really stressed me out: Kishan
305.article_body: Ishan Kishan said he keeps trying to figure out how MS Dhoni's mind works, adding that attempting to do so really stressed him out in an IPL match. "I was playing well...But then Dhoni bhai walked up to the bowler and said something. And in my mind, I'm wondering what Dhoni bhai has told him," stated Kishan.

306.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara to invest ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures
306.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara Technologies will invest over ₹18 crore in US-based game fund Bitkraft Ventures. Nazara will invest ₹6.5 crore upfront, while the balance investment amount of ₹12.2 crore will be deployed over a period of three years. Earlier in March, Nazara Technologies had announced its commitment to invest ₹30 crore into Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll.

307.title: HAL hands over first set of Gaganyaan hardware to ISRO
307.article_body: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) on Monday handed over the first set of Gaganyaan hardware to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) in Bengaluru. "HAL has and will continue to play a significant role in India's current and future space programme including the Gaganyaan manned mission to space, given the skills and knowledge base within the company," said ISRO Chairman S Somanath.

308.title: Mumbai man sexually abuses 4 minor boys after offering money for 'falooda'
308.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing four minor boys in Mumbai between March 24 and 31. Police said the man allegedly lured the boys under the pretext of giving them each ₹50 to have 'falooda' (dessert). The accused, who is a relative of one of the boys, allegedly took the nine-year-old to his room and molested him.

309.title: Military situation in Mariupol is very difficult: Ukraine Prez
309.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the military situation in the southern port city of Mariupol is "very difficult". Zelenskyy added that Turkey had proposed a plan to help evacuate injured people and dead bodies from the city, but warned the initiative depended on his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin's will. Reportedly, around 1,30,000 people are stuck in Mariupol.

310.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4.8 crore linked to AAP's Satyendar Jain
310.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹4.81 crore linked to Delhi Minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain in a disproportionate assets case. The investigation revealed that during 2015-16, certain companies beneficially owned and controlled by Jain received accommodation entries from shell companies against cash transferred through hawala route. Further investigation is underway.

311.title: PM asks BJP lawmakers to create awareness about govt schemes
311.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has asked ruling BJP lawmakers to attend the fortnight-long programmes from April 7 to create awareness about the government’s "social justice" and "people-centric" policies. A BJP functionary said the lawmakers and ministers have been asked to create awareness about 14 central schemes at the local level.

312.title: Mumbai man injured in fight over parking spot, gets 20 stitches
312.article_body: A man in Mumbai received as many as 20 stitches after getting involved in a fight over a parking spot for a two-wheeler on Friday in Mumbai's Santacruz. "The fight started after one Imtiyaz Baig asked Farhan Sheikh to remove his motorcycle from the lane, with families of both men getting involved," police said. Two brothers have been arrested.

313.title: 5 killed, several injured as van crashes into train in Hungary
313.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 10 injured on Tuesday after a van crashed into a train in Hungary. The authorities said all of the deceased victims were travelling in the van. The train, with 22 people onboard, derailed due to the collision. They added that the van carrying local workers drove onto the tracks while ignoring red lights.

314.title: 3 killed, 30 injured as double-decker bus overturns in UP; CM expresses grief
314.article_body: Three persons were killed and 30 sustained injuries when a double-decker bus overturned on the Lucknow-Gorakhpur national highway in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday morning while trying to overtake another vehicle, police said. CM Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolences to the bereaved families. He also directed speedy relief and rescue efforts by sending the District Magistrate and SSP to the spot.

315.title: If you don't get Buttler out early, he'll take the game away: Morkel
315.article_body: Ahead of RR's match against RCB, ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel said RR batter Jos Buttler is one of those batters who'll take the game away if you don't get him out early in the match. "Sometimes the bowling unit needs to say it's his day and enjoy the show," added Morkel. Buttler scored 100(68) in RR's last game against MI.

316.title: Russia says Wikipedia could be fined over 'false' info on Ukraine
316.article_body: Russia has said that Wikipedia can be fined up to $48,120 for failing to remove "material with inaccurate information of public interest" about the situation in Ukraine. Earlier, the Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Ukraine's invasion. It said Russia's takedown request threatens censorship.

317.title: PWD to install LED lights on 8.5 km stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh
317.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department has decided to remove the dark spots on an 8.5 kilometre stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh junction with high-tech automatic LED lights. "The stretch will have cycle tracks. Music speakers have been installed so more people use this stretch and women do not feel unsafe," said a senior PWD official.

318.title: Officials seek 5 new lifts, 2 ramps at Pune railway station
318.article_body: Pune's railway division officials have sent a proposal to railway headquarters seeking installation of five lifts and two ramps at station for convenience of disabled and elderly commuters. According to proposal, two lifts will be installed on first platform, while the rest will be installed on five other platforms. The ramps will be attached to a newly-constructed foot-over-bridge at station.

319.title: Dearness Allowance for Karnataka govt employees hiked by 2.75% to 27.25%
319.article_body: The Karnataka government on Tuesday announced a 2.75% hike in the Dearness Allowance (DA) payable to its employees in the revised 2018 pay scales and under the seventh pay commission. Employees will now get 27.25% DA with effect from January 1 this year. This comes days after PM Narendra Modi approved a 3% hike in DA for central government employees.

320.title: Girl named 'Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha' on Aadhaar denied school admission in UP
320.article_body: A girl in Uttar Pradesh was denied admission to a government school as her Aadhaar card carried her name as "Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha" and "Baby Five of Madhu". While a photo of her card went viral online, the District Magistrate said it was a mistake caused by gross negligence and strict action will be taken against those involved.

321.title: Kangana loses cool at paparazzi for waiting outside her home, says 'Stop it'
321.article_body: Kangana Ranaut lost her cool at paparazzi, who were waiting outside her home to click her pictures. In a video shared by a paparazzo on Instagram, Kangana can be seen getting out of her car. However, she declined to pose for the shutterbugs and asked them to leave. She said, "Will you come here every day now? Stop it."

322.title: Row over loudspeakers at mosques will backfire BJP in elections: Siddaramaiah
322.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and said that the Karnataka BJP is "manipulating society with communal issues for their political gains" because the Assembly elections are nearing. "This will backfire BJP in coming days. Speakers are installed in temples, mosques and churches for a long time now. What harm did it cause to people?" Siddaramaiah added.

323.title: Maha BJP leader offers to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa
323.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has offered to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa. "Anyone who needs a loudspeaker...can ask us for free!" he said. This comes after MNS leader Raj Thackeray urged the state government to remove loudspeakers from mosques and added that if it was not done, he would play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers.

324.title: 18-year-old gamer claims headphones saved him from a bullet in US
324.article_body: An 18-year-old gamer from the US claimed on Reddit that his headphones saved his life from a stray bullet. "A stray bullet went through my window and hit the headphones on top of my head," the teenager's post read. "If it wasn't for the headphones made with good quality I would've been a dead kid at 18," the post said.

325.title: Group sex video of female teacher & her students recorded by her lover in TN; arrested
325.article_body: Tamil Nadu Cyber cell has launched an investigation into a group sex video involving a 42-year-old female school teacher and boy students. The video, which was allegedly filmed by a 39-year-old  businessman who was the teacher's lover, had reportedly been shared by his friends. The teacher and her lover have been arrested.

326.title: Even your husband won't be as proud as I am: Satish to Rupali on 'Anupamaa'
326.article_body: Actor Satish Shah said that he is proud of actress Rupali Ganguly for her performance in 'Anupamaa'. "Even your husband or any other family member won't be as proud as me...this is coming straight from my heart...I swear Rupali darling...you are doing...fantastic job...I always knew you were...very fine actor when you had joined us in Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai," Satish added.

327.title: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passes away at 79
327.article_body: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passed away aged 79 on March 30 due to heart failure at the Vancouver General Hospital, Canada. He won an Oscar in the Best Documentary Feature category for 'Just Another Missing Kid'. Zaritsky's work has been broadcast in 35 countries and screened at more than 40 film festivals around the world, including Sundance and Toronto.

328.title: Ranveer's performance in Jayeshbhai Jordaar 'tour de force': Producer
328.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' producer Maneesh Sharma said that actor Ranveer Singh has delivered a 'tour de force' performance in the film, adding that his acting makes him marvel yet again at the artistic heights Ranveer's capable of. "It's always a mix of pride and joy to collaborate with Ranveer. The early promise I sensed in Ranveer has been realised," added Maneesh.

329.title: Unfortunate that Sanju hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India: Akhtar
329.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it's unfortunate that RR captain Sanju Samson hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India. Akhtar added, "Sanju should play more matches for India, I think he's one of the finest players." Akhtar further said that England batter Jos Buttler's talent has also not been recognised yet.

330.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announces task force to deal with gangsters
330.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday ordered the formation of an anti-gangster task force, led by an officer of the Additional Director General of Police rank, to deal with gangs in the state. The task force will be formed to combat organised crime and it will have an integrated collection of intelligence, manning and execution of operations, officials said.

331.title: Objective of Criminal Procedure Bill is to protect citizens' human rights: Amit Shah
331.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill has been brought with the objective to protect the human rights of crores of law-abiding citizens. "Its sole objective is to improve the conviction rate in the country…Send a strong message in society," Shah added. "It had not been brought for any misuse," Shah stated.

332.title: Jadeja has given headache to Dhoni to look after field setting and everything: Harbhajan
332.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that he feels that MS Dhoni is still the captain of CSK. "Jadeja has given headache to MS Dhoni to look after the field setting and everything [when he goes and fields outside the ring]," Harbhajan stated. "Jadeja needs to stand up and talk about a few things," Harbhajan added.

333.title: Former Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal diagnosed with prostate cancer
333.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal said that he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. The 70-year-old, who is currently in charge of the Netherlands national team, made the announcement on Dutch TV programme Humberto. Manchester United tweeted, "Everybody at Manchester United is fully behind our former manager...in his battle against cancer. Sending you strength and courage, Louis."

334.title: West staged mass killings in Ukraine's Bucha to discredit us: Russia
334.article_body: The mass killings of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are part of a deceitful attempt by the West to "discredit Russia", Vyacheslav Volodin, Speaker of Russia's lower house of Parliament, said. "Washington and Brussels are the screenwriters, directors and Kyiv are the actors," Volodin added. Bucha Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk on Saturday said that nearly 300 civilians were killed by Russian forces.

335.title: 1 lakh methamphetamine tablets worth ₹30 crore seized in Mizoram
335.article_body: Crime Investigation Department (CID) seized one lakh tablets of methamphetamine worth ₹30 crore in Mizoram's Aizawl, police said. The CID team raided the Zohnuai area in the Vaivakawn neighbourhood following a tip-off. The tablets were seized from the possession of a woman peddler, a resident of Farkawn village in Champhai district bordering Myanmar, police added.

336.title: Jason Momoa to star in historical drama 'Chief of War'
336.article_body: Jason Momoa is set to star in Apple's historical drama 'Chief of War'. The 'Aquaman' star is also attached to write and executive produce the limited series. The series follows the story of the unification and colonisation of Hawaii from an indigenous point of view, Variety reported. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman 2' and 'Fast & Furious 10'.

337.title: I wouldn't pick Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG: Hogg
337.article_body: Brad Hogg said he'll not include Australia opener David Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG on Thursday, even if he's available and will choose Tim Seifert instead. "I would want more right-handers to face Ravi Bishnoi as he's very dominant against left-handers with his wrong ones," he added. Warner joined DC camp late due to Australia's series in Pakistan.

338.title: B'luru woman who collapsed in gym died of cerebral haemorrhage: Autopsy
338.article_body: The post-mortem report of a 35-year-old woman who died after collapsing while working out at a Bengaluru-based gym has revealed the cause of death. According to the report, her death was caused by a cerebral haemorrhage, which was the result of a blood vessel rupture caused by stress in the brain. Footage of the woman collapsing was captured on CCTV.

339.title: Sanjay Raut's properties attached by ED in ₹1,000 cr land scam case
339.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in connection to the ₹1,034 crore Patra Chawl land scam case. A plot owned by Raut in Alibaug and another flat of his in Mumbai's Dadar were attached. Raut, who is a close aide of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, tweeted, "Asatyamev wins."

340.title: Govt blocks 22 India, Pak-based YouTube channels for spreading fake news
340.article_body: The government has issued orders to block 22 YouTube news channels, three Twitter accounts, one Facebook account, and one news website. "The...channels...were used to spread fake news, and coordinated disinformation...on subjects sensitive from the perspective of national security," the government said. The blocked YouTube channels include 18 India-based channels and four based in Pakistan.

341.title: Shut meat shops during Navratri, respect sentiments: East Delhi Mayor
341.article_body: East Delhi Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal has urged meat shop owners to close their establishments during Navrati and respect Hindu sentiments. "We don't consume even onion-garlic during Navratri," he added. Further, he said there's a rule that meat shops will remain shut on Saptami, Ashtami and Navami. "If slaughterhouses will be closed, meat will not be sold," he said.

342.title: IIT grad who attacked police in Gorakhpur didn't meet family for 3 yrs: ATS
342.article_body: The IIT-Bombay graduate who attacked two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Sunday did not meet his family for the last three years, the UP ATS said. ATS officials visited Navi Mumbai where the accused, Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, used to live with his family. UP Police said Abbasi forcibly tried to enter the Gorakhnath temple premises.

343.title: How much are petrol and diesel prices expected to further rise according to experts?
343.article_body: Experts have noted that retail prices of petrol and diesel need to be hiked by ₹0.52-0.60 for every $1/barrel rise in the price of crude oil for oil marketing companies. The price of Brent crude has risen by about $28.4/barrel since November 4 to $108.9/barrel, indicating that fuel prices could see further hikes of ₹5.5-7.8/litre each on petrol and diesel.

344.title: Gets stressful but I'm my fans' baby: Rashmika on living up to expectations
344.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she would be lying if she said that it doesn't get stressful to live up to the expectations of fans. "But I am my fans' baby...I like it when I do something they like...Making them happy is what keeps me going...which keeps me motivated to work harder and keep getting...better at what...I do," she added.

345.title: 9 criminals nabbed in 2 separate shootouts with Noida Police
345.article_body: Noida Police on Monday said that they have arrested nine suspected criminals in two separate shootouts, leaving five of them injured. The accused were involved in theft and kidnappings, according to the police. The police also said that they have recovered four pistols, five knifes, two cars and one bike from their possession.

346.title: H'yana to stay in Chandigarh until money given for new capital: Vij
346.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has said that the state will "stand firm" in Chandigarh until it gets "one single decision over Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water, Hindi-speaking regions and money from the Centre for establishing a new capital." Earlier, Punjab passed a resolution to transfer Chandigarh to itself. "[Haryana won't] pull back...'Angad ka paer' from Chandigarh," he added.

347.title: 3 killed, 6 injured after bus comes in contact with live wire in Jaisalmer
347.article_body: Three people were killed while six others were injured after a bus came in contact with a live wire in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. According to ASI Mukesh Beera, the incident occurred on Jaisalmer-Chelak road when the bus was returning from a fair in Guhda village. One person who was critically injured was referred to a Jodhpur hospital, police added.

348.title: J&K students who cheered for Pak still in jail for lack of bail money
