348.article_body: Three Kashmiri students, facing sedition charge for celebrating Pakistan's victory over India in the T20 World Cup, are stuck in Agra Central Jail despite getting bail owing to lack of money to pay for the surety deposit. "Their release from jail still seems a distant dream because the court has asked us to deposit ₹6 lakh," said a student's uncle.

349.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt to get married on April 17 at RK Studios: Report
349.article_body: Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will get married on April 17, as per a report by ETimes. "Alia's grandfather N Razdan wanted to see her getting married to Ranbir...The ceremony will be held at RK Studios and nothing extravagant has been planned yet," the report said while quoting a source. It will reportedly be a close-knit family affair.

350.title: Pic of female sniper called 'Charcoal' surfaces amid war in Ukraine
350.article_body: A picture of Ukrainian female sniper known as 'Charcoal' is being widely shared online, with people calling her a "national hero" amid war with Russia. "We must take them all out. These people are not human beings. Even the fascists were not as vile as these orcs. We must defeat them," she said in a speech.

351.title: Torture chamber used by Russians found in Bucha, 5 corpses found inside: Officials
351.article_body: Authorities in Ukraine said they've discovered a torture chamber in the basement of a children's sanatorium in Bucha. Bodies of five men with their hands tied were also found in the chamber used by Russian troops, they said, adding that their deaths are being investigated as a war crime. Mass graves have also reportedly been found in Bucha.

352.title: Tired of waiting, keeping options open: Son of Cong's Ahmed Patel
352.article_body: Late Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son Faisal Patel, in an apparent reference to the party leadership, on Tuesday said he was tired of waiting around. "No encouragement from...top brass. Keeping my options open," he tweeted. He had earlier said that he will enter electoral politics if Congress asks. Ahmed Patel was a close aide of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.

353.title: RR's bowling against Plessis, Kohli is going to be a big test for them: Hogg
353.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RR lack pace in their attack and their bowling against RCB's Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli is going to be a big test for them. "RR are going to be put under extreme pressure...Their bowling is probably their weak link," he added. RR will play against RCB on Tuesday night.

354.title: US seizes $34 million worth of crypto tied to illegal dark web acts
354.article_body: The US government has seized $34 million worth of cryptocurrency tied to illegal dark web activity. The cryptocurrency was seized from a US resident who used an online alias to sell over 100,000 illicit items across marketplaces on the dark web. The majority of the sales are said to be hacked account information from major services including HBO and Netflix.

355.title: Single most annoying problem on Twitter: Elon Musk on crypto scam bots
355.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, whose 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday, said crypto scam bots are the "single most annoying problem on Twitter". He was replying to a Twitter user who suggested that "improving the verification system to prove that you're an actual real human" would help with the problem. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

356.title: SC to hear electoral bonds case, says would've heard earlier if not for COVID
356.article_body: Supreme Court has agreed to urgently hear pleas challenging the laws on the issuance of electoral bonds. "Had it not been for COVID-19, the court would have heard the case earlier," CJI NV Ramana said. Advocate Prashant Bhushan cited a report before the SC stating that a Calcutta-based company paid ₹40 crore through electoral bonds to bypass excise related issues.

357.title: Peers gave idiotic advice, parents told me not to listen to bulls**t: Vivaan
357.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah said he made the mistake of chasing stardom and success early in his career and he wishes he would have had listened to his parents. "My peers...and my friends were filling my head...with all kinds of idiotic advice...I must be like this to be a star or leading man...My parents told me...not to listen to...bullsh**t," he added.

358.title: I have miserably failed with regular love stories: John Abraham
358.article_body: John Abraham said he has miserably failed when he has done a regular love story, adding that he has not acted in a love story that is different for a long time. Discussing his untitled upcoming film with director Abhishek Sharma, John stated, "You'll scratch your head and think, 'What were you thinking when you decided to do this?'"

359.title: No alliance with TRS in Telangana: Rahul tells state Cong leaders
359.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has told the Telangana Congress leaders in a meeting at his Delhi residence that there will be "no alliance" with TRS for the next year's state elections. "We held a discussion with Rahul ji over various issues...He will visit Telangana this month. No alliance...Congress will fight against TRS and BJP," said PCC chief Revanth Reddy.

360.title: PMC, police assure support for grand Ambedkar Jayanti celebrations
360.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and police have assured support for grand celebrations to commemorate Ambedkar Jayanti on April 14. "I can assure cleanliness, provision of drinking water, washrooms and pandal at the statue of Babasaheb Ambedkar near the collector's office," PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. Drone cameras may be deployed at locations for safety purposes, he added.

361.title: Salman felt that Sajid didn't have enough faith in his stardom: Report
361.article_body: Salman Khan's production house 'Salman Khan Films' will reportedly produce his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', with producer Sajid Nadiadwala backing out of the film. "Salman felt that Sajid had developed cold feet and was not putting enough faith in the project and his stardom, whereas Sajid felt that Salman was taking things too lightly," the report added.

362.title: Films where dance is a natural element usually turn out very bad: Shahid
362.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said there have been many times in the past where songs have been added in his films just because he dances well, even if the song doesn't suit the movie. "Genuinely, I have been searching for a film where I can dance, and where dancing feels like a natural element...But the films...[of] that genre...[are] usually...so bad," added Shahid.

363.title: UK to launch its own NFT this summer, may use it to issue debt
363.article_body: UK's Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has directed the Royal Mint to introduce the country's own NFT by the summer, Economic Secretary to the Treasury John Glen said. He added that the NFT would be a symbol of the "forward-looking approach [the UK is] determined to take". The government may even consider issuing debt using the NFT, Glen said.

364.title: Sri Lanka's condition worrisome, India's could be worse: Sanjay Raut
364.article_body: Reacting to Sri Lanka's economic crisis, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the country's situation is "worrisome". He further added that "India is on that path" and warned that if situation is not handled then India's condition will be worse than Sri Lanka. "Mamata Banerjee has also said to call for an all-party meeting under PM Modi's leadership," Raut added.

365.title: GB Nagar Police starts 'anti-Romeo' drive to ensure safety of women
365.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has launched an 'anti-Romeo' drive in the district to ensure the safety of women, officials said. Women police personnel will carry out patrolling at crowded places, including metro stations, schools and colleges, ACP Ankita Sharma said. Police has also issued a helpline number where locals can raise a request for such a drive in their neighbourhood.

366.title: Twitter account of ex-IPS officer's wife hacked, complaint filed in Mumbai
366.article_body: Lawyer Abha Singh, wife of former IPS officer YP Singh, filed a complaint with Worli Police, alleging that her Twitter account was hacked on Sunday and the hacker demanded $500 to give her complete access to it. The accused reportedly put a Muslim man's picture as the profile picture. "I...changed the passwords of my other social media accounts," Singh said.

367.title: We must have a common culture post-merger: HDFC Chairman
367.article_body: HDFC and HDFC Bank "will have to have a common culture" after the merger, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Tuesday. "Now, bank will have to deal in housing loans which is very emotional, personal...So we have to be very careful with all our customers," he added. As per the announcement, HDFC will acquire a 41% stake in HDFC Bank.

368.title: Bangladesh to lodge official complaint about sledging, umpiring after Test defeat to SA
368.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) will file a complaint with the ICC about sledging and umpiring during the Durban Test, which Bangladesh lost by 220 runs against South Africa. As per Bangladeshi players, umpires ignored their on-field complaints. The board said that the umpires also extended the lunch session to make up for half an hour instead of starting early.

369.title: Zomato shares decline after CCI orders probe
369.article_body: Shares of Zomato fell up to 5% on Tuesday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered an investigation into the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy. Zomato said it will assist the CCI in their investigation into the preferential listing of restaurant partners and pricing parity across platforms. Zomato shares later pared losses and were trading 2.61% lower on NSE.

370.title: Zebra foal born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park
370.article_body: A zebra foal was born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park on Monday. With this, the total count of zebras in the park has increased to five. "All necessary arrangements, including a partition within the enclosure to provide privacy and safety, have been made," said Deputy Director of the biological park. According to an official, the foal is suckling and active.

371.title: Mt Everest like you've never seen it before: NASA on pic of Earth's highest mountain
371.article_body: NASA shared a picture of Mt Everest and wrote, "Mt Everest like you've never seen it before." "The highest mountain on Earth takes on a different perspective from...vantage point of space. An astronaut aboard the International Space Station...took this near-nadir (almost straight down) photograph of Mount Everest, which towers approximately 29,029 feet (8,848 metres) above sea-level," wrote NASA.

372.title: Boss in UK pays 60 employees over ₹74,000 each to help them pay bills
372.article_body: A boss in the UK paid 60 of his workers £750 (over ₹74,000) each to help them pay their bills amid rising living costs in the country. The 51-year-old MD of Emerys Timber and Builders Merchants said he wanted to "share back the success of the business". UK energy regulator Ofgem has announced a hike in the energy price cap.

373.title: Man flies down to B'luru from Gujarat to snatch chains, arrested
373.article_body: A 26-year-old man, who allegedly came to Bengaluru by flight to commit chain-snatching to keep his wife happy, was detained by CK Achukattu Police. The accused, identified as Umesh Khatik, was arrested after police gathered information on a snatching case in which the bike-borne miscreant had snatched two gold chains from a woman on December 26 last year.

374.title: Ukraine Mayor, her family members found dead with hands tied: Police
374.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found the bodies of the mayor of Motyzhyn village, her husband, and their son. Police said the dead had their hands tied behind their backs. The bodies were reportedly found half-buried in a grave in a pine forest near her house. Olga Sukhenko and her family were allegedly abducted by invading Russian forces on March 24.

375.title: Bill Gates shares old video of himself jumping over chair as Microsoft turns 47
375.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, took to Instagram to share an old video of himself jumping over a chair to celebrate 47 years of Microsoft's existence. "It took leaps and bounds to accomplish Microsoft's vision of a computer on every desk and in every home," wrote Gates. Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975.

376.title: Sounds reasonable: Elon Musk on 'two conditions' for edit button on Twitter
376.article_body: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, responded "that sounds reasonable" to a tweet suggesting "two conditions" under which an edit button should be introduced on Twitter. The tweet suggested that the edit button should be available only for a few minutes and that the edit history should be visible. Musk owns a 9.2% stake in Twitter.

377.title: Pic shows dog refusing to abandon Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops
377.article_body: A picture has been widely shared online showing a dog refusing to abandon its Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops. Reacting to the picture of the dog sitting next to the body of its owner, a Twitter user wrote, "Such a heart-rending picture, I hope someone can take this poor dog in and feed and love him."

378.title: SpaceX, NASA delay launch of 1st private astronaut mission to ISS
378.article_body: SpaceX, NASA have delayed the launch of the 1st all-private mission to the International Space Station, Axiom Space's Ax-1 astronaut mission, to April 8. The mission will fly four civilians, including former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría, for a 10-day mission to the space station. The crew will ride atop a Falcon 9 rocket by Elon Musk's SpaceX.

379.title: Saffron-coloured caps, energy bars with PM's pic distributed to 400 BJP MPs
379.article_body: During the parliamentary meeting of the Bharatiya Janata Party, 400 BJP MPs were given saffron coloured caps and energy bars with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's picture on the wrapper. The caps were reportedly prepared in Surat after the party leadership approved the final design. The caps have the name and symbol of the party on them.

380.title: Ukrainian woman writes family details on daughter's back in case she's killed; pic surfaces
380.article_body: Ukrainian mothers are writing family details on their children's bodies in case their parents are killed by Russians. Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's former spokesperson tweeted a photo, saying, "A Ukrainian mom wrote on her daughter's body the name, date of birth, numbers of parents so if she is lost or they are killed during war someone can help the girl."

381.title: It's not only for azaan: K'taka CM on demand for loudspeaker ban in mosques
381.article_body: Commenting on the demand by some organisations to ban loudspeakers in mosques, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "It is not only for azaan, it is for all loudspeakers." He added that it is a high court order and it is not forced. "Everything has to be done by talking and explaining to people...So, we will take a call," Bommai stated.

382.title: DJ Khaled to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
382.article_body: DJ Khaled will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 46-year-old American DJ will be the 2,719th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "DJ Khaled is one of the most popular and ever-present impresarios of the rap industry and we're thrilled to honour him!" said Ana Martinez, Hollywood Walk of Fame Producer.

383.title: My parents were separated; didn't tell anyone I'm Pankaj Kapur's son: Shahid
383.article_body: Shahid Kapoor revealed that he initially feared that he wouldn't make it as an actor. "My parents were separated, and I didn't use to live in Bombay, I came here...late," he said. "My mother was a single mom, and I was a little older while Ishaan (Khatter) was very young. I never told anyone...[about being Pankaj Kapur's son]," he added.

384.title: MNS Muslim leader resigns, accuses party of turning 'communal'
384.article_body: A Muslim politician, Majid Shaikh, has tendered his resignation from the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) by accusing it of being "more focused on communalism". "Raj saheb was an icon for me...that's why I had joined...in 2009. But now...politics of communalism has crept in MNS," Shaikh said. Notably, the Pune-based politician was an MNS branch head.

385.title: Haryana CM moves resolution on Chandigarh issue, Sutlej-Yamuna canal
385.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday moved a resolution in the state Assembly noting with concern the Punjab Assembly's recent move on the transfer of the joint capital of Chandigarh. Khattar's resolution also urged the central government to take steps to construct the Sutlej Yamuna Link (SYL) Canal. He accused Punjab of enacting legislations to deny Haryana's rightful claims.

386.title: Tharoor shares 2018 tweet on edit button, says 'Even our bureaucracy is quicker'
386.article_body: Amid speculations of an edit button on Twitter, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor remarked, "Even responses from our bureaucracy tend to be quicker." Sharing his 2018 tweet, where he called for an edit button, Tharoor wrote, "If it's real, thanks for listening in 2018 and acting in 2022!" Twitter on April 1 had said it was working on an edit button.

387.title: Russian troops need significant re-equipping & refurbishment: UK
387.article_body: The British Defence Ministry said that Ukrainian forces have retaken key terrain in the north after forcing Russia to retreat from the areas around Chernihiv and north of the capital, Kyiv. "Many Russian units withdrawing from northern Ukraine are likely to require significant re-equipping and refurbishment before being available to redeploy for operations in eastern Ukraine," it added.

388.title: Our belief within ourselves is what I believe is going to help us win: Plessis
388.article_body: Ahead of their match against RR on Tuesday night, RCB captain Faf du Plessis addressed the team and said that their belief in themselves is the most important thing that'll help them win this tournament. "Everyone should play their part to get us across the line...we don't rely on one big superstar to win us the trophy," he added.

389.title: 3 rob driver of his taxi in Punjab, give him ₹150 bus fare to reach home
389.article_body: Three miscreants, posing as passengers, robbed a driver of his taxi in Punjab's Khanna. The accused had booked a taxi to Khanna, who upon reaching the destination, took out their gun and asked the driver to get off. They also gave him ₹150 bus fare to reach Moga, where he belonged while fleeing, the cab driver told police.

390.title: Maximum temperature in Delhi to touch 39 degrees Celsius today: IMD
390.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said that the maximum temperature in Delhi is expected to touch 39 degrees Celsius, while the air quality index (AQI) may stay in 'poor' category. The minimum temperature is likely to stay at 19 degrees Celsius, as per IMD's forecast. On Monday, the maximum temperature was recorded at 38.1 degrees Celsius in Delhi.

391.title: Stepped as a student, not co-star: Charan on working with dad Chiranjeevi
391.article_body: Speaking about his experience of working with his father, actor Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', actor Ram Charan said, "It's a dream come true...I don't think I stepped into 'Acharya' as a co-star, I've stepped...as...student and I've learned a lot from him." "He never handheld me through any of the shooting days...He let me make mistakes...But...never lost his cool," Charan added.

392.title: Facial recognition system to be launched at Pune airport in 2023
392.article_body: A facial recognition system will be launched at Pune's Lohegaon Airport by March 2023, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said in Parliament. The system will be launched as part of the Centre's Digi Yatra initiative to provide passengers "seamless and hassle-free experience at airports". The system's preliminary testing has been completed, he added.

393.title: NCPCR objects to textbook chapter by Harsh Mander, writes to NCERT
393.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has objected to the inclusion of a chapter titled 'Weathering the Storm in Ersama' authored by social activist Harsh Mander in Class IX English textbook. In a letter seeking reply from NCERT, the rights body said the story suggests that rescue and welfare work are done only by NGOs.

394.title: Was told should do ₹150-cr film, people will put money after Kabir Singh: Shahid
394.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that after the film 'Kabir Singh', everyone said that he should do a ₹150-crore film and that people will back him up with money. "I thought, sure they will put money, but what will the film be? There's a difference between making a scaled film and a good film," Shahid added.

395.title: I admire Aishwarya's dignity in tough times; lucky to have her: Abhishek
395.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan praised his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and said that he and his family are lucky to have her in their lives. "She's always been an amazing emotional support for me," he added. "[Aishwarya] has...managed to traverse some of the most difficult times of her life with utmost dignity and grace. I...admire that about her," Abhishek said.

396.title: Determined to do whatever needed to ensure Cong's unity: Sonia Gandhi
396.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi said the road ahead for the party is "more challenging than ever before", which will put to test the party’s dedication, determination and spirit of resilience. "Unity at all levels of our vast organisation is of paramount importance and speaking for myself, I am determined to do whatever is needed to ensure it," Sonia Gandhi added.

397.title: Amy recalls joke on Alec's shooting incident that wasn't allowed at Oscars
397.article_body: American stand-up comedian Amy Schumer said that she wasn't allowed to make a joke about last year's shooting incident involving actor Alec Baldwin. "Don't Look Up is the name of movie? More like don't look down the barrel of Alec Baldwin's shotgun...I wasn't allowed to say any of that, but you can just come up and [slap] someone," Amy added.

398.title: It's strange but there will be some banter: Harshal on facing Chahal
398.article_body: Talking about playing against his ex-RCB teammate Yuzvendra Chahal when RCB take on RR, all-rounder Harshal Patel admitted that it will be a little strange but added that there will be some banter. Harshal recently became the second player to bowl two maiden overs in an IPL match, after recording the feat against KKR.

399.title: Abandoned at vacant plot, 1-day-old girl dies in Ludhiana
399.article_body: The body of an abandoned newborn girl was found on a plot in Ludhiana on Sunday. The girl, who had her umbilical cord still attached, appeared to be a day old, police said. Locals were reportedly alerted by her cries, but when they reached the spot, she had already succumbed. Police are scanning the area's CCTVs to trace the accused.

400.title: PMC to begin online licence renewal process for Pune hospitals
400.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to start an online registration process for all city hospitals wherein they will be able to renew their licence every three years through the online process. "Earlier, it used to take about 21 days for the documentation process...online system will reduce the time taken for the documentation to under a week," an official said.
